title: A brutally honest take.
text:
I've tried almost every dating site there is. I don't think anyone would label Craigslist a "dating website" but what's the difference because this and the countless others? Nothing really. In the end everyone is looking for that one person. The thing is that one person might be for one night or one lifetime. I've seen it all. So have you. We probably come on here because it's more anonymous than others. No pictures are needed. I can almost guarantee a large % of the people reading this are in a "committed" relationship or even married. 
So why come here? Because they're fucking bored. They want to know someone else out there still appreciates them. Someone that will still say they're beautiful and sexy. Single or in a relationship, it's about curing the boredom. We want that fix. We want to know that at any moment there's someone who will reply and give us that rush. That feeling of euphoria that our lives are missing. 
How many times have you been talking to someone for minutes, hours or days and you think to yourself, "This person gets me!" "How come I am telling them all this personal stuff without ever meeting them?" Wanna know why? Because there's no fear. There's no judgment. You can admit to all the reckless, slutty, criminal, mischievous things you've done inside and outside of relationships. We all want someone we're not. We want someone who will take us to that higher level. We either want to fix someone enough so they're who we want them to be, or we want someone to fix us and carry us to a new path. We want someone who will light a fire. Someone who will transcend all the bullshit. Someone who will rock our world inside and outside of the bedroom and keep us coming back for more. 
But what are we doing about it? Are we the best person we could be? Do we love ourselves and our bodies enough to warrant all the fantasies we have in our minds? Are all the good ones taken or are we just one of the others? The others who float through life. Paycheck to paycheck. Counting down the hours at work until you get that next bottle of wine popped open. Craving for that Facebook crush to FUCKING SEE ME. 
We're all fucking damaged in some way. That's why we're here. Whether you're a gorgeous 10 or a so-so 6. Whether making 25k a year or 250k. We're all damaged. We all have that one person(s) who we would give anything to shove it up their fucking nose just one time. "See me now motherfucker!?! Take a good, hard look at this!!" 
But it's all a dream. A fantasy. Or is it? So we settle. Settle for ourselves and settle for someone who doesn't treat us the way we want and deserve. Settle at a career that is BS. A boss we would love to send to Syria for a few weeks. We settle for some boring ass sex when deep inside we want to be fucked like a porn star. We settle for not helping ourselves. What's one more cookie? One more doughnut? I'll go to the gym tomorrow. "If they can't love me for who I am then they don't deserve me anyways!" That's BS and inside we all know it. We need to cling to an excuse. 
The good ones in life will let you go if you're not doing enough for yourself. They can't be bogged down by your average existence. Proximity is power. Why hang around a loser when there's success around the corner? That's what I've realized. It hurts. But it works. You will NEVER find the one if you're average. It's better to be at rock bottom and show someone that you have the ambition and drive to be a success than just average. 
That's all I got. If you read it this far I thank you. You just proved you're more than average.

title: Successful, Kind and Athletic Seeks Short, Smart and Cute
text:
A Wall of Text appears! 
Here is a bullet-point summary:

I'm child-free, non-religious and the picture of physical health
I have my act together personally, professionally and emotionally
I have a variety of interests and have run a successful business since 2003
I want to focus my life on myself, my partner and the people who are close to us
Awesome adventures are nearly always better with a companion
It's OK if you feel like you still have some growing to do--I know I do!

My name is Matt. I am 31, happy, healthy, and independent. I live in Seattle and have had my own place for over eight years. I own and operate a successful business that I started over a decade ago. I am drugs, disease, and drama-free. I am GGG, do not smoke and only drink socially, in moderation. I make excellent coffee and enjoy tea. My mind, body, and heart share equal intensity--I seek balance in the things I do and the personal characteristics I develop. I can make some promises before we even meet: you will never have to fear physical, emotional, or verbal abuse or violence from me. I will never become a drug addict or alcoholic. I always be a physically and mentally-engaged person. Over the last couple years, I have done a number of remarkable things.


Friday nights you can find me out wrapping up my 10k-20k steps for the day, hitting up some bar karaoke and grabbing a beer at my regular spot. Otherwise, I am home reviewing my loadout for a weekend climb. Or, I might already be out on the mountain--establishing basecamp for an early morning summit bid.

One of my goals for the next two years is to build my business to the point where I can step back and draw a livable monthly income--without having to actively work in the business. As a parallel/supplemental goal, I want to "retire" extremely early. I have done some cool stuff, but there is a lot of other cool stuff that I still want to do--ideally with my partner. I want to "work to live", not "live to work".

I'm looking for a woman in her 20's or around my age who is independent but also ready to meet and spend some time getting to know an awesome guy. This woman is a non-smoker and drinks in moderation. She's also a foodie and enjoys experimenting and trying new things. She wants her life to be one of variety, exploration and modest creature comforts. She's healthy/fit, enjoys the outdoors in good company and spends her time learning and challenging herself. She is comfortable with or even excited by the possibilities of a life without procreation.

She's short or petite--under 5'6? She's bright, fun and has a strong sense of self-worth. Perhaps you are this woman. Perhaps you know her--a friend, a relative, a neighbor, a coworker. All I know is that I haven't found her yet.


If you like what you see and what you read, write me and tell me a little bit about yourself. Please keep it relatively short, as I'd rather get to know you over coffee/tea, or happy hour and billiards. I was fair enough to provide a variety of photos, so please include at least one which clearly shows your face.

Matt

title: This post is filled with puppies, kittens and unicorns [LTR]
text:
I swear.

They were right here. RIGHT here. All these little puppies trying to run but, instead, falling over and just rolling around with their little stumpy puppy legs. Kittens wobbling and mewing and curling up with them while unicorns pranced arou - THERE! Right there! Did you see it? A kitten riding on the back of a silver unicorn! Little paws holding tight to rainbow colored mane! Oh my gosh, no. I'm not lying. It was right there. Uuuugh.

I'm so sorry, I'm sure they'll come back around. Just have a seat and we'll wait it out.

How about that crazy rain, huh? Yeah. And then sunny this morning. Really crazy. Yeah. Weather, huh?

Yup.

Weather.

Come here often? I mean, dang, I mean to Craigslist! Ugh. I'm so bad at this. I... look. There was only one kitten. And it was really a cat. My cat. Who IS pretty awesome. The unicorns and puppies were hypothetical. Especially the puppies because my room is totally decked out with awesome 80s unicorn posters. That's real. Maybe.

I just thought, you know, I needed to step up my game. With puppies. And kittens. And unicorns. But while you're here... maybe we could chat a bit? We could talk geeky stuff. Or politics. I love listening and learning and have an open mind. Share your passions with me and I'll share mine with you. I'll crack some semi-witty comment here and there and you can do the same until we're laughing and coming up with our own inside jokes.

When it gets late, I'll scrounge for a bottle of wine and a pack of cards. Or a board game. Or a movie? It's all good. We can pretend we're part of MST3K and riff on some movies. Or ignore the movies and make out. Or just cuddle and relax and let it all unwind, you know? Life is stressful and sometimes it's good to just relax.

I do have two kids. Roughly 50% of the time. Not looking for a mom and I don't have ex drama. We're all good there. My kids are pretty awesome, too. All I ask is that you're cool with kids.

But, this is about us. Me and you. Chatting, laughing, going out to bowl or play mini golf or get some drinks and people watch. And, you know, walk around and hold hands. And share secret kisses. I'll compliment your ass if you compliment mine. 

And then we can sit together, tipsy and draw our own unicorns. I have TONS of crayons and colored pencils and pens with glitter in them. Trust me. We're good.

What do you think? Yeah?

title: Here for another Month. Short Term Romance/Friendship?
text:
Hello,

As the title says, I'll be in the area for about a month, so obviously I'm not seeking a long term relationship. But that doesn't mean we can't still have a connection and enjoy each other's company-- even if only for a short time. 

What I am looking for is a girl who I can feel calm and comfortable around. It'd be really interesting hearing about your specific walk-of-life. Whether it is a commonly-tread path, or one that is a little more unique. Somebody who loves food is a plus (that isn't code for BBW btw). Somebody who isn't quick to judge others is an even bigger plus. This doesn't have to be a physical thing, at all. It's mostly up to you and what you are comfortable with. I just mostly want to enjoy each others' company, whatever form that takes.

So about me: I'm slender to average build (175 lb), 6 feet tall, and I'd say I'm a generally good looking guy (but what does that mean coming from me? Hah!). I'm mixed, but overall I look more black than anything else. I'm in my late 20s and am working a standard schedule. My work can be pretty demanding, especially in this next month (Which will make the occasional retreat to you all the more meaningful!). I really love food, and I don't mean that in a fancy or gluttonous way. I just really appreciate it as an art and a pleasure. I like to cook, and love homemade food. I prefer takeout over a restaurant, but I can sit through a restaurant just fine. I enjoy doing random things and have little preference over what those things are honestly. It's more about who you are with than what you are doing. But mostly I'm a homebody. After work I like to relax and maybe watch something (movies, musicals, anime, disney, documentaries, old sitcoms). I'm also a long time fan of video game, mostly single player and offline (unless we are talking about old school Nintendo games with a group!). title: Sex, anyone?
text:
It's Sunday night, and we both decided to check out craigslist at the end of a long day. Welcome to the modern world, I guess. 300 years ago, I guess we would have met at church or something - or maybe we'd be cousins.

I've been giving this ad a lot of thought because I thought, who's going to respond to something that could have been written by anybody. You know, the type of thing that lists what I'm looking for, what I have to offer, and then just hopes I get a few bites. It seems like I'm a lot more likely to find someone to chat with if I offer a little bit of my personality here.

I suppose, though, that I do need to fulfill some of the general requirements of the cl ad genre. I do need to tell you what I'm looking for. 

Sex.

Yep. I was pretty blunt about it. And you're not surprised because you already knew it's what men want, and it's what women want too - just a little further down the line most times. Plus it's in the title of my ad.

(By this point, I'm guessing you're already a little turned on by my impeccable grammar and spelling. Hold on a little bit, though. Put that vibrator back in the drawer.)

I'm looking for someone in particular, though. Someone playful and ideally super flexible. Maybe you do yoga, tai chi, or you're a former gymnast. Could you also please be intelligent and speak another language? Sapiosexuality is a thing, and totally underrated. Sex is 99% mental.

I do want to try some new things with an interesting person. Someone who I know I want to have lots of dirty sex with because we get along so freaking well over drinks and maybe dancing. Someone who's uninhibited and knows what she wants and isn't afraid to ask for it. 

Whether you're just reading this ad for fun at this point or you're actually interested, ask yourself: How many people in our culture are actually willing to make themselves vulnerable and ask for what they want? Depressingly few in my experience. That's why I think it's such an attractive quality.

Women who have interesting and diverse perspectives on life. That's what I want. Not somebody who's going to agree with everything I say or doesn't have an original thought of her own. I'd love it if you liked to read - especially if you have interesting and new books/films to introduce me to.

Oh! And you freaking love to travel and try things you've never tried before, like camping under the stars or swimming in a cold lake or jumping out of an airplane. You have a moral compass, and you're not afraid to let people know about it. Probably, you're black, asian, latina, or mixed. Or - you're just a super cool and up-to-date white chic who understands what the hell is going on in the world. (Forgive my sexist language. I'm trying to be hip.)

Did I mention I'm looking for sex here? 

You dig white dudes who shave their head. Maybe you even have a thing for rubbing their head (not like I care or anything). 

I feel like you probably know a lot about me already. Do I even need to make a list of things that come with getting to know me? Probably.

The trait I value most in others is compassion. Being smart or clever is cool, but if your rude or inconsiderate, I'm not interested. Also, I'm tall.

That was a lot. Let's trade pics if you're interested. I'm attractive. I bet you are too. Let's chat - and happy Sunday!

title: 20 Qualities to look for in a Lifetime Partner
text:
It's easy to list what you find unappealing in a potential mate, but identifying the qualities that make someone desirable for the long haul is a slightly tougher task. What exactly qualifies a person to fulfill the role as your life partner? Not everyone runs a mental checklist before taking the ultimate leap - some just know. But regardless of whether you choose to follow that instinct, it doesn't hurt to validate that he or she is the one.

To distinguish between someone who's good for right now vs. someone you want to wake up next to every day, consider the following list. If there's someone in your life with these 20 qualities, don't let go.

Supportive of your passions and decisions: He or she should be your biggest cheerleader and encourage you to pursue any endeavors despite how it may affect them.

Adds value to your life: Not in terms of monetary value - your partner should contribute a quality that inspires you to grow, whether that means he or she is smarter or more ambitious than you. (But make sure you can provide the same.)

Can be completely silly with you: "Till death" is a long ride that should be filled with the most fun moments. Along the way, they shouldn't have a problem being playful with you or exposing his or her inner child without inhibition.

Adores you: Even if you're not one who needs the validation, your partner should show how much they love and adore you without necessarily putting you on a pedestal.

Is willing to compromise: The two of you will never not disagree on something, so make sure he or she is open-minded to your needs and desires, too.

Treats your family just as well: If your partner shows zero respect for your friends and family, it's hard to ignore, even if he or she has no problem showing their appreciation to you.

Values your opinions: Your partner doesn't have to agree with you at all times, but he or she should be able to respect your beliefs (without imposing theirs on you) despite them being different from their own.

Loves him/herself as much as they love you: The best partner is someone who can stand alone without constantly depending on your company or attention. He or she should be comfortable with themselves and be totally secure without you there.

Trustworthy: Even if every other aspect of your relationship is solid, the power of doubt is hard to dismiss. Problems down the road will be inevitable if you're constantly second guessing his or her honesty (and vice versa).

Exhilarates you, doesn't deplete you: Your partner should make you excited about life and its offerings. He or she should never make you feel bad about yourself or diminish your spirit in any way.

Has a life outside of the one you share: It's important for your SO to understand that you have a life of your own and to encourage you to enjoy things without him or her.

Doesn't hold grudges: Despite any bumps in the road, your life partner should seek to improve your relationship rather than dwell on any setbacks.

Brings out the best in you: Your partner should not provoke your inner worst qualities - only the ones that make you a better you.

Loves all of you: This includes your flaws, especially. Your personality traits don't come Ă  la carte so he or she should be able to embrace you as a whole, shortcomings and all.

Accountable: He or she should be able to put aside their ego to be held accountable for any mistakes. Your partner should own up to them rather than place blame on someone or something else.

Allows him/herself to be vulnerable to you: Communication will prove to be the hugest challenge if either of you have a wall up. Your SO should feel comfortable enough to confide in you with all of his or her fears and secrets.

Keeps you in check, without dictating: It can get boring when someone is in constant agreement with you for the sake of not wanting to upset you. When you're out of line, he or she shouldn't be afraid to challenge you and respectfully point out your wrongdoing when necessary.

Allows you to be you: It's difficult to be fully happy in a relationship when you're forced to suppress any part of you. You shouldn't feel restricted whatsoever, whether that includes being able to freely pursue your hobbies or to be your silly self.

Dependable: You should always be able to rely on your partner for anything, from emotional support to upholding his or her commitments. You don't want to have to waste time worrying about if they're acting irresponsible.

Is easy to be with: Every relationship comes with its battles but by no means should it be a daily war - that can get exhausting. Although the need for improvement is never-ending, your partner should be your counterpart, teammate, and best friend, and mutual happiness should come with little effort.

********************************************************************************

So, please share with me how in the hell you can determine if the person you met has any or all of
these qualities or attributes if you make a decision based on a profile, picture or within 5 minutes
of meeting? 

I see all the profiles and ads of you wanting a relationship, yet you have so much baggage and 
fear that you don't get away from the computer long enough to truly "meet" someone...

Dating is ever so challenging, why are we making it so much more difficult....???

title: Quoth the raven [LTR]
text:
Once upon a Saturday dreary, while I typed, lonely and weary,
Over perhaps too much hard cider and Fireball-
While I hovered, nearly posting, suddenly there came a tapping.
As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my bedroom wall.
"'Well that's kinda creepy," I muttered, "Probably a ghost, possessed doll-
Or just some Mormons come to call."

Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak March;
And each gloomy, dark rainy day creeping closer to Spring.
Eagerly I wished the weekend; - for the weekday work to start to mend
Filled with hiking, games and movies - but yet missing an importing thing-
For a relationship, lovely and rare, to blossom from a fling-
For my email notification to ding.

And the raspy, creepy squeaking of my bedroom doorknob
Scared me - filled me with dread never felt before;
So that now, to my endless shame, I squealed like a pot belly pig
"Oh my god! A home invasion or the clown from It at my door-
Or, no, that makes no sense, it's just my fat cat walking across the old floor;-
That it is and nothing more."

Into my dominion, a black shape streaked
And before I could shriek, it lands, eyes malicious with intent to kill
"Oh dear lord," said I, "Too many shots, not enough sleep!
I'm hallucinating a bird in my room - impossible! Yet, still-
It's mouth opens and I must prepare for an omen most ill."
But the bird only said "Chill."

"Prophet!" said I, "thing of evil! - prophet still, if bird or devil!-
Whether Cupid sent, or whether spawn of some dark will,
I seek a woman, friendly to geeks and hiking through woods-
Someone to stand by and for my love, secrets and attention to spill,
Active and funny, but willing, in evenings to put on Netflix-"
Quoth the Raven "And Chill?"

All right. I should definitely not attempt these while super tipsy. Sheeesh. Uh, hello!

Kinda like the above. Well, except the whole Netflix and Chill thing but that's part of the joke. I mean, yes, definitely one of the ways I show I care is through affection, physical and spoken. And I am definitely a big fan of cuddling on the couch with a movie. But, I'm looking for something long term, not just a one night stand.

I have two kids about 50/50 with no ex drama. I can't have more kids. So, I'd reaaaaally like if you are cool with kids. In the sense of (once, way down the road, you're introduced into their lives) you'll get down and play with them sometimes and interact with them. I'm doing just fine taking care of them and raising them. They're pretty awesome kids.

I am a geek but I like to get out as well when the weather is nice. A little bit of relaxed hiking or day trips over to the beach or just walking along the waterfront. Also, bowling or any other fun games out and about. Ooooorrrr games inside like board games or card games. Let's do it!

I have a cat that's a sweetheart. No raven, though. Sorry. 

Tell me about yourself! And, please, send along some pictures.

Thank you for reading!

title: I'm looking for my soulmate! (real ad here)
text:
Hello ladies! I realize this ad is long but if you're looking for the same thing I am, the more you can learn about me upfront the better. Especially, when it comes to the most important things. What I'm looking for is a future wife, plain and simple. Don't get me wrong here, I'm not trying to run out and elope tomorrow because I'm a little more realistic than that! Relationships take time to develop and futures have to be carefully planned out but I do want someone who's looking for something permanent like I am. Some would say that Craigslist is the last place a person should hope to find their soulmate but why not? You're on here, I'm on here and doesn't everyone else who gets on here shop at the same grocery stores we do? With that being said, who cares where you meet someone as long as you're compatible? We can always tell our friends and family that we bumped into each other at Winco!

I'm starting this off by listing 5 categories that include my "must haves" in a relationship. I'm looking for someone who can relate to ALL of them and I can't settle for anything less than that. This is about finding someone to spend the rest of my life with so we will need to be firing on all cylinders! I don't know about you but I'm tired of wasting years of my life with the wrong partners. I'm either looking to hit the jackpot this time or go home empty handed!

#1. COMMUNICATION - This is at the very top of my list. I don't care how attracted you are to each other, how much you have in common or how great the chemistry is between you. If you can't problem solve, your relationship has no where to go. It's as simple as that. What this requires is having the ability to communicate what's wrong in a tactful manner, the willingness to compromise and a forgiving spirit whenever problems arise because you can rest assure they will! Those who can't do this end up being single or in and out of relationships their entire lives. There's absolutely no room for selfish thinking when there's someone else in your life to consider. Some people think it's cool to be stubborn but on the contrary, it's a good way to find yourself alone in the end. 

#2. QUALITY TIME - I don't understand couples who live under the same roof and merely co-exist together. They barely even talk to each other and just go through the motions every day like programmable robots. The woman usually has her cell phone attached to her ear while she's making dinner and yelling at the kids while the man is drinking a beer and watching the game with a friend. This is just an analogy but you get the point. By the time the evening is over, they haven't spent one second of quality time together all day long. This goes on month after month, year after year and then they can't figure out how their marriage failed! Although there's nothing wrong with having an evening like that from time to time, there needs to be a balance as well. The typical "ho hum" attitude just isn't in my DNA. I'm a passionate person who likes to go out and do things that are fun with the lady I'm sharing my life with and I also need to feel a connection there. The whole purpose for me is to have a best friend, a partner and a companion. Not just a roommate. You have to be creative sometimes to keep the fire going in your relationship or the flame will die out because nothing runs on automatic pilot.

#3. AFFECTION - I tried to be in a relationship before where the woman was non-affectionate and that doesn't work for me. Human touch is a beautiful thing and it can be a lonely world without it. I love to hug, kiss, cuddle and feel close to the person I'm with. I'm not talking about smothering your partner or attaching yourself to them like glue because everyone needs their personal space, but it's nice to come home to someone who will wrap their arms around you when you've had a long, exhausting day!

#4. SEX - It would be safe to say that I'm definitely not like most men in this area! For one thing, I don't have much of an interest in strip clubs, porn or dirty magazines (unless it's WITH my partner) which eliminates about 50% of the male population. I also don't cheat or desire other women when I already have one. That takes care of the other 50%! In addition to that, I am a pleaser who's totally unselfish in bed. To give you an idea, there have been times when I have given a girl 2 or 3 orgasms but then stopped without taking care of me because she enjoyed herself and I didn't want to ruin it by overdoing it! The #1 aphrodisiac for me is knowing that my lady is finding pleasure which leads me to why I'm not possessive, jealous or controlling either. In fact, I'm the exact opposite. Let's put it this way... If my future wife has the courage to tell me that she wants to fuck another guy, who am I to say no? Lol! Just her bringing that to my attention would instantly turn me on and I would reward her for her honesty. It took me years to figure this out about myself and then I had to learn to accept it but now that I have, I want this to be a part of my future sex life with someone! Don't get me wrong, I'm not looking for a girl who's going to be promiscuous and sleep with everyone who comes along but I would definitely let her fuck a guy that she was hot for and wanted badly or I would let her have a "friend with benefits" as a regular. That would actually be ideal and safer. As long as there were no pregnancies, diseases or emotional attachments, I'd be perfectly fine with that! Honesty is the key here and if everything is out in the open, there would be no reason for lying or cheating to enter the picture.

#5. TEAMWORK - I don't believe in gender roles. Just because I'm a man doesn't mean I can't shop or that my woman can't mow the lawn. I have never agreed with that old fashioned philosophy. I think the responsibilities should be divvied up according to who's better at what. That's how your household will run smoother and more efficiently. Then, whatever is left over is either done together or you take turns. Teamwork is about defending each other as well. When someone is talking shit behind my back, you speak out and stand up for me. Some women will just sit there and let the person carry on without ever saying a word or even join in! That's not right and you won't have to worry about that on my end because I don't tolerate people saying negative things about my woman. Especially to my face. Teamwork also applies to finances. You both contribute to the bills but you also carry each other through tough times. I hate to say it but that means if I lose my job, you'll step up and support the household until I can find something else (without giving me a hard time about it) just like I would do for you. It's bad enough to be unemployed. The last thing you need is your significant other making it worse for you. Relationships are a partnership and there are enough people in the world that don't care about you so the least you can do is care for one another. I've been with women in the past who moved in with me and didn't pay a thing for months which no one had a problem with but the rare times when I needed to lean on my lady, I got treated like shit and reminded every day of how she's not going to support her man. To sum it up, selfish women like that have no place in my life. 

Well, that is my 1-5 list. If we're on the same page, I would love to hear your comments on all of them. Please include that with your response in as much detail as you can. The list doesn't cover everything because how you live, what your personal goals are, habits, pet peeves, etc. are very important to know as well but this is a great start. Also, I have listed some my personal interests below so maybe you can tell me what we have in common in this area too...

Camping, fishing (a big plus!), Kayaking (I own two of them), singing karaoke, going on long drives and taking photos of the scenic areas, snuggling and watching a good movie (especially in the winter months), cooking, having BBQ's & trying new restaurants, playing board games. going to the zoo and the aquarium, checking out a comedy club, doing light gambling at the casino and eating at their buffet, going to the mall around Christmas time, spending the day at a state fair or an outdoor event, listening to music, watching a good ballgame, going to museums and international emporiums, etc. 

Finally, I used to have an age preference but now I'm not sure what I want! I'm attracted to younger girls but then I have to put up with the games and immaturity. Especially with sex. They're still using it to get things in life like a promotion, a guy with money or a baby for themselves and they haven't figured out yet that it's fun and feels good! The older women understand that completely so the sex is there without all the BS but then you have to put up with the stubbornness, how set in their ways they are and the bitter taste they still have from their former marriages. The younger women are more open about planning a future together because they have a whole life ahead of them but it's hard to relate to this era concerning the styles, the lingo, the mentality and the music. The older women are from a generation that hits home so you have that in common but you can forget having a future with them because they already have their car, their house, their career, their children, etc. and they want to keep it all to themselves! It's a crap shoot but if I were to pick a side, I would either have to go with a younger woman who has an old soul or an older woman who looks young! The only real preference I have is that I'm not interested in heavyset girls. That doesn't mean you should expect a male model here though. I'm just an average looking guy but I do believe that I have above average qualities. I'm 38 years old, 6ft tall, on the stocky side, semi-dark complected and I have neatly trimmed facial hair. I'm willing to send you my photos upon seeing yours. If we're attracted to each other and we agree on my 1-5 as well, I would LOVE to hear from you and take it from there!


Here are some funny one liners and commonalities for you to enjoy...

I hAtE wHeN pEoPLE tYpE lIkE tHiS.
Fighting for peace is like fucking for virginity.
I get this urge to smile when someone is yelling at me.
I like changing a word when I can't spell the one I really want to use.
Going to McDonald's for a salad is like going to a whore for a hug.
I redo high fives when they're not good enough the first time around.
I hate when I'm yelling at someone and I mess up what I'm saying.
Sex is not the answer, sex is the question. Yes, is the answer! 
Your story doesn't add up so feel free to stop lying anytime now.
I love it when a person's laugh is funnier than the joke.
I forgot your name so I'm waiting for someone else to say it.
Virginity is like a soap bubble. One little prick and it's gone! 


Have you ever looked at your watch and then you don't know what time it is so you look again and you STILL don't know?
How about when you walk into a room and have to go back to where you came from to figure out why you went in there in the first place?
Have you ever noticed that all day Wednesday you keep thinking its Thursday but then the very next day you're back to being alright again? 
Have you ever been talking to yourself and when you get caught you have to pretend like you're singing? 
Have you ever been at a railroad station where one train starts to move and you can't figure out which one it is?
Have you ever tried to get someone to wipe something off their face but they never seem to rub the right spot? 
Have you ever been walking up a flight of stairs and you think that there's one more step but there isn't and then the next thing you know your stomach is in your chest? 
Have you ever fallen asleep in the late afternoon and when you wake up you don't know what day it is?
Have you ever tried to sneeze while you're taking a piss? Is it even possible?

If you laughed at this we're off to a good start!

title: Very Truly Looking for a Christian Lady.....
text:
_______________________________________________________________________

Dear God: 

I know I'm not the best person in the world, but it would really mean a lot to me if you let me run into a good woman for me. Would she please be Christian, intelligent, fun, and most of all, have a good heart? You know... the kind of woman that can lift her man's heart up when he's down? The kind of woman that has a smile on her face when she goes to bed and when she wakes up. A woman who loves Jesus above anyone else? 

And let's have a great conversation, to see if we are both EVENLY YOKED, or somewhat close is good too. 

*** you don't have to answer the questions, just seeing if they ever crossed your mind... per-say *** 

1.) Do you believe in infant baptism? 
2.) Do you believe that you are a sinner and that Christ had to come and die for your sins? 
3.) Do you believe that it was your sins that nailed Christ on the Cross? 
4.) Do you believe in the sacraments of the alter (communion)? 
5.) Did you make a decision to come to Christ or did Christ call you? 
6.) Do you believe in the confessions of sin? 
7.) Do you believe that you can work your way into heaven? 
8.) Do you believe that you are 100% Saint and 100% Sinner? Why - if yes to that question. 

So please God... can you send me just one woman who can bring out the best in me, and vice versa? Will you let me care about her and let her care about me? I'll be patiently waiting until then. 

A little about me... I am 33, and I am a man who loves Jesus and I work hard. I been looking for love online, since it's not a good idea to pick up on women at church, or bars or at work. I do not go to bars, because I don't drink. I don't date women from work, not a good idea all the way around on that. I am 6 foot 4 and 250 pounds, and yes I am chubby (but working on it, I do alot of walking and drink lots of water), and NO I am NOT looking for a barbie. I see it as how you treat me and what's on the inside counts more, because beauty is ONLY skin deep. 

Well, I'm looking for a confident, charming, and a thoughtful lady, someone who doesn't need an instruction book. I am direct, sarcastic, loyal, funny, and very sweet of course. 

Anyway's reply if you want someone to date and in time fall in love with and be loved and cherished, I am the marrying man type, meaning in a few year's we can talk about the M word. 

Looking for Fun! And if Love Comes with It, Then Even Better. 

Send me a message, if you like what I am about..... 

Thank-you very truly much...... 

PS - IN THE SUBJECT LINE - WRITE " I AM NOT A BOT "

title: Let's makeout in the rain
text:
** PLEASE NOTE **
Due to the spammers and bots and what not, please type your favorite Movie, TV or Book VILLAIN in the subject line when you reply. 

Also, please include a PICTURE with your reply. And at least a little something about yourself.  Thanks! **

- - - - - - 


The Short Version: (Just The Tip, I Promise)

Tall Scottish-born awesome guy (with velvety accent) seeks a super-duper girl (with strange taste in men) who:

.Loves to laugh til it hurts; .
.Enjoys chatting about everything and nothing. (The absurdity of life, and everything inbetween).
.Adores marathon make out and snuggle sessions just for the hell of it.
.Agrees that intimacy, humor, and frequent, honest communication are crucial components for a healthy and vibrant relationship.
.(And rather enjoys the idea of dressing up in thigh highs and boyshorts - or knee socks and tank-top - for her partner every third Wednesday. Weather permitting, of course).
Above all, I just want to spend quality time with someone fantastic, and embrace our perfect imperfections; a best friend to enjoy life with - laughing, kissing and exploring as we go.

Above all, I just want to spend quality time with someone fantastic, and embrace our perfect imperfections; A best friend to enjoy life with - laughing, kissing and exploring as we go.

A mutual love of movies, music, and playful, silly banter is essential. Make me laugh and I'm yours. Sing along with me in the car, and we'll conquer the world. Romance, intimacy and being present in a relationship is pretty damn important to me. As is Communication. Equality. Trust. Respect. Partnership. Touch.

I am not interested in casual encounters, one night stands, poly / open relationships, or looking to date multiple people. No judgments, but non-exclusive is not for me. Hell, I don't even kiss on the first date. What kind of strumpet do you take me for? ;)

I heartily embrace my kinky side, but with a healthy appreciation and respect of the vanilla. Think of me as a kinky ice cream float, if you will. With sprinkles. Dirty, filthy, sprinkles.

A relationship should be just like Bill & Ted. Two great friends trying their damnedest to be excellent to one another.

p.s. I am actually 6ft. No one likes it when you pretend to have an extra 2 inches. Trust me on this.

If you hate long-ish profiles, then pretend mine stops right here. (I'm a grow-er, not a show-er). You will already know if my pictures made you want to scale my broad shoulders like Mt. Rainier, or if my silly ramblings made you chuckle out loud, rustle your undercarriage in delight, or simply just had you nodding your head in sage agreement.

But if for some debauched reason you love reading profiles that contain more humor and autobiographical shenanigans than you were perhaps prepared for when you logged on today, then you are in luck, dear reader. Your secret is safe with me. Take a deep breath, and hold on to that towel...

No refunds.

----

I should point out that unless you live local it would make it very hard for us to hang out because I do not have a car. (I am, however, learning to drive). So yes, I am lame. But better you knew that sooner than later.

Random things I can't do without:

.Making out with someone who REALLY knows how to kiss. (Or rather, making out with someone that kisses the way you both love to be kissed - no stabby porn tongues, shocked fish or perpetually out-of-sync kissers allowed). The ability to fully arouse with JUST a kiss, and the kind of breathless, pants-wetting hunger that stimulates bodies into action. Good kissing chemistry is essential.
.A playful, open and inquisitive mind. 
.Sex & sexuality in all it's forms - especially being GGG. (Good, Giving, and Game). 
.Honest and open two-way communication - in life and in love.
.The joyous feeling of uncontrollable, stomach cramping laughter. 
.Fabulous underwear, and the women who enjoy wearing them. 
.........

I've put a lot of thought and reflection into trying to understand what worked, and what didn't, in my past relationships (and why) and therefore what I seek in any future relationship.

So hopefully you have read this far and understood that I want nothing more than to spend the rest of my days accompanied by my best friend in life and in love, laughing til our sides hurt, and constantly having to press rewind to catch up on the things we missed during our impromptu make-out session(s).

As for the mentions of intimacy peppered through the profile - I was hesitant to put anything overtly sex related in my profile, or to even mention terms like Dominant/submissive, kink, D/s, DD/lg, etc. for fear of giving out the wrong impression. But there are aspects to sex and intimacy, from the plainest vanilla to those aforementioned kinky sprinkles that are very important to me and that I feel would be key to a healthy sexual relationship - with me, at least.

There is a lot of slut shaming out there, which is sad. It's next to impossible for a woman to put on her profile what she is looking for with regards to sex and intimacy with a partner. And if you don't put it out there, it becomes rather difficult to find the like-minded, truly knotty people out there. So I figured, I've spoken to enough women to know that they enjoy sex just as much as me. And we all have our kinky likes and loves. So the hope is that you will read this and go 'wow, me too!', and get to experience one of the best feelings in the world - connecting with a like-minded person about the things you love. Because god knows we've all been shamed for what we like at some point. Or felt misunderstood or rejected. And when you dress up in that new sexy outfit, and your partner acts like they could care less, why would you even dress up for them again? No one likes to be humiliated. Or shamed. So here we are.

If you are the type of person who would describe their sexual interests as being closer to the kinky side of the scale, then you'll know it's highly unlikely you will find a person that likes *everything* you may enjoy. But you will have your favorites, things you feel you absolutely need to experience in a sexual relationship on a fairly frequent basis. (Or at least have a partner that shares a genuine enthusiasm for trying out the things you enjoy).

So I definitely have my core needs. And then things i'd be happy to experience with a partner, but could do without. And then the dealbreakers, which i'm just not into (I am not a fan of drawing blood, - so needle play, fire play, hooks, etc - each to their own, but it's not for me).

That being said, I will gladly strap you down or tie you up, pin you to the wall/bed/car door/alleyway as forcefully as you desire, or whisper the filthiest things you can possibly imagine while swatting your behind until it is fire-engine red - if that is what floats your boat. (And I suspect if you have read this far, it probably does).

** From experience, we would likely not be a match if: **

.You dislike (or are allergic to) cats. I don't have any, but I adore them, and would like to have one or two in my life.
.You smoke, take hard drugs, and/or are an alcoholic. (I hate all kinds of smoke, even e-cigs. And I dislike the smell of weed, in all it's forms. Alas, they play havoc with my ability to breathe).
.You are in bed by 9pm every night.
.You believe in Creationism/ Intelligent Design or rely on Him/Her/It to guide your daily actions. (Spirituality is fine, but hardcore bible thumpers, not for me).
.You believe that climate change is a hoax, 9/11 was a government conspiracy, or watch Fox News for anything other than masochism.
.Your collection of crotch rings set off airport metal detectors. (No offense, they just make me squirrely).
.You do not support gay marriage and equal rights for same-sex partners.
.You have an STD, or any form of HSV (including cold sores, etc).
.You are on the rebound, never been kissed, a virgin, never had a long term relationship, or just don't have time for one.
.You have a dislike for facial hair or foreskins. Sorry ladies, they are a permanent feature and non-negotiable.

title: Looking for lifting cutie and more! :-)
text:

title: Out of my mind - or - There is no spoon
text:
Now why would I post this in Seattle, when I live near Oak Harbor? That one is easy, there are far more people in Seattle than there are here plus it's pretty darn conservative on this side of Penn Cove.

So here's a few things I'm looking for and how I pertain to whatever it is:

I am atheist. No I don't go telling everyone how I feel about it, but at the same time, I don't need religion to be any particular kind of person. I don't have any beefs with religion, but I have zero intention of stepping foot inside of a church to do churchly things (aside from the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster - beer volcanos and stripper factories in the afterlife woo!).

I'm debating caucusing for Bernie. However unless he really blows it out here in the rest of March before the local caucus, unfortunately I think he's not in a position to take the nomination. If he doesn't, I'm ok with Hilary. If it's Hilary and Trump at the general election, I'll be voting for Hilary, but if Trump wins, I'm pretty ok with that too as it warms the cockles of my heart to see political parties implode. Aside from that, whoever the next president is doesn't affect me or my business in the slightest. Politicians in general are a bunch of slimy snakes in the grass. All I can hope is a demo wins, gets a left leaning scotus going and we can stop all the debate on gay marriage, abortion and so on. People need to mind their own damn business and let things that have no bearing on your personal life alone.

I have never been married, I have no children - I would spoil any to death - ours, yours, random street children, babies kidnapped from local hospitals in daring midnight robberies, adopted children from strange countries and so forth. However, my mother lives in my house, and is also my business partner. I do exceedingly well at my business, and certainly have my own space as my house has rooms to spare. I'm totally ok with kids of any age as long as they don't mind that I get up at 3-4 am and am usually in bed by 8 or so. I work my butt off so I can have a few toys and be debt free and pay off my mortgage in short order. I have no intention of retiring, I'd go stir crazy. In no way is my situation the typical "basement dweller" most people picture. However, I realize most people can't live with their parents in any capacity, so I don't expect to find a lot who would.

I don't drink. Never got into it. I don't mind of someone has a drink now and then. 3 or 4 a night, you need some AA meetings in your schedule.

I don't do drugs. I'm totally ok with the green stuff, and at some point I'll stop in a shop and buy a cookie, but that's about it. I've done it a handful of times years ago, not my bag. Other than that, drugs are right out.

I don't smoke. If you smoke, or vape, it'll never work.

I'm debt free, aside from a Mortgage. I'll also have my house paid for in 10 years. If you are swimming in anything more than a small credit card, or actually have been sued for not paying your bills, I'll pass.

I don't take prescription drugs to make it through the day and really will pass if you do. Now I'm not talking about the I have high blood pressure kind of drugs, or I have pollen allergies, I'm talking about the I must take drugs to not stab people in the streets kind. It sucks you need those, but I dated a few people taking those and it never worked. Also if you need pills to sleep, I'll pass on that too. I can sleep through massive wind storms and as before, I dated some people taking those and it really brings out the crazy in people it seems.

I'm 45. If you're much older than that, I'll take a raincheck until I'm much older than that. If you're way under that, I'd never want to feel like a dirty old man. I don't know many people under 35 that would consider someone my age anyway as I have a pretty good chance of making it a lot more years, and who wants to be shacked up with some wrinkly old dude when you're in your prime. I say that and Hugh Heffner managed to nab a whole bunch of hot models. Go figure.

I'm a fat guy. I make no bones about it. I'd been a fat guy my entire life. I eat pretty darn decent these days, and after a recent checkup, I still have cholesterol levels people would pay cash money to have, good enough I'm less than average chance to ever have heart disease. I'm healthy, I rarely get sick (unless I snag something from the places I work, which happens from time to time). I'm not super picky on looks and if we exchange pictures and you don't like mine, no harm no foul.

I have all my hairs. I have all my teeths. I am trying a small beard/mustache thing at the moment but that could change on a whim. I am incapable of growing one of those duck dynasty style (bleah) beards, as mine just spreads out, like a low pile carpet.

I go to sleep around 8 and get up anywhere from 2 to 4 most days, including weekends. I work all over the state, so I put a ton of miles on my car. I am perfectly willing to show someone I'm dating how to do the work I do, but I don't expect it, other than I'm busier than a 1 legged man at an ass kicking contest. If you are unemployed, it probably won't work out, as I'm not the loan department, nor free housing alliance.

I have zero tattoos. If you have some that's fine. If you look like a walking art project, I'll just say it's not a big turn on for me, but opposites attract at the same time. Ink doesn't make the person anyway. I also have no piercings of any sort.

I play games on the pc every once in a while. In any given week I probably spend 1 to 2 hours playing whatever. I watch a small amount of recorded shows, walking dead (about ready to give it up though, either give them a happy ending or kill the lot of them off already), the magicians, venture bros, bobs burgers, gumball, suits. I rarely watch tv that I haven't done via the dvr or on demand (yes I have Comcast, horrible horrible overpriced no option for anything else Comcast). I like a decent variety of movies, but I've been so busy lately I didn't even get to see the new Star Wars, or Deadpool. I will definitely make time for the new Batman/Superman movie though.

I'm Caucasian. I'm good with whatever you are, white, black, brown, really if you're female, that's about my only criteria. Short, tall, it's all good. 

So now that I've rambled on forever, if you interested, shoot me a reply. If you think I'm funny, I usually am. You don't need to send a picture if you don't want too. Just remember I live near Oak Harbor, so if you can't get up here from time to time (cause I'm down around everywhere on this side of the state a lot), you may want to pass on by. I can text but calling me while I'm working, and texting me every 5 seconds will net about zero response as I'm either busy, can't answer because of phone restrictions in the building, or I have no reception. I don't bite, much, but have not garnered a taste for the flesh of the living so we're probably all safe, for now.

title: I'm going to be alone forever...
text:

A handful of relationships and countless awkward first dates that never see a second? Why do I have to be so shy and timid? Why can't I express myself like how I can through text? Even when I sit next to someone I feel more at ease typing out a message than I do saying something aloud.

I'm sorry that on my dates I struggle to make eye contact. I'm sorry that when I talk it's through a mumble. I'm sorry that I seem disinterested. It's not you, I swear. Most of the time I sit there trying to think of things to say way to nervous to say anything and seem like an idiot. I don't want you to think I'm a loser. I just sit in my room all day reading stuff online or trying to learn something new. Maybe playing a game while talking to my friends through voip.

I wish I could find you. The person who will sit there in awkward silence with me as we send text messages back and forth. Who cares if we are right next to each other. The person who will argue amd and Nvidia with me. Who will remind me what we went to the store for so I don't end up making 3 trips.

title: We didn't meet on Craig's List!
text:
We can contrive an elaborate story how we met. We can say we met at the Seattle Art Museum. How I was admiring the elegant clean lines of an African wood carving when I was distracted by the even more impressive lines of your slender figure in a little black dress. And how we had drinks across the street at the Four Seasons before moving onto the Pike Street Market for dinner and more drinks.

Or we can say we met on the slopes when we shared a double chairlift and then spent the rest of the day together discovering powder stashes before hitting the lodge and an apres ski hot tub. 

Or we can say we met at Linda's, trying to distract ourselves from V-Day. We looked blearily across the bar through half full whiskey glasses and it was love, or lust, at first sight. Several boilermakers later we stumbled out together into a grey cold night and uber'd home. 

Or we can say we met say we at the Cinerama. Pathetically going to the movies alone, our reserved seats were fatefully right next to each other. We watched previews argued about whether regular or chocolate popcorn was better. We drank beer and wine with our popcorn and struggled to keep our hands to ourselves while we watched Star Wars. After the movie we crawled through the pubs of Belltown together. 

So if you want to meet, tell me which way you'd like to say we met, how old you are and include photo. And remember, we didn't meet on Craig's List.

title: Are we a good fit? Take this fun quiz! [LTR]
text:
I haven't done a lot of dating in my life, mainly because I haven't had a strong drive to do so. Until recently. Now I'm trying to find a wife.

I believe that a lot of online dating attempts are a waste of time, because one person or both have no idea what they should look for in the other. So I'm going to make it clear what I want, and if you think you're the one, chances are really high that I'll be what you're looking for as well.

So let's pretend you're doing a test in one of your lady magazines! That should be fun! Each qualification has points attached - tally your points at the end to see our compatibility. Send me an email with your score, even if it's really low!

Quiz:
* All the points - You are a Christian. I want us to have the same priorities in life. If you don't love Jesus more than you love yourself, stop here because I'm not interested.

* Subtract your age from 39 (my age) to determine your score for this one.

* Politically, I love liberty, I think government should be as small as possible, and I think taxes are bad. Add 30 points if we have this in common and this is important to you, or score yourself an amount of points that describes you. If politically you like socialism, an authoritarian government, and leftist/progressive ideals, your score for this is -50.

* You share my goal in life to build a loving family with smart, Jesus-loving kids. Score: 15 points

* You and your family are intelligent. I don't care what education you have, just your ability to reason and think, because I want to enjoy talking to you and I want you to raise smart kids. Mothers are too important for me to marry a bimbo. Score 10 points.

* You agree with this statement: "I would never get a divorce." Score 10 points.

* You agree with this statement: "I would get a divorce if I stopped loving my husband." Score -10 points.

* I'm just selfish enough to want my kids to be like me. I'm ethnically northern European, and culturally I fit in here in the US with white people. Score 10 points if this also describes you, or score less for how different we are.

* Good for you for not being irrational and crazy! Score 10 points, or slide it down to -10 if you are very irrational.

* I think freckles are attractive. Score 5 points if you have lots of them, 0 if you have none.

* I'm 5'10", score 5 points if that's cool with you, or less if you wish I were shorter or taller.

* I'm not a big drinker, are you? Score 3 points for "I have an average of less than 2 glasses a day, of something like wine", down to -3 for "I have a problem that you're going to have to deal with."

* I like clean living. Score 5 points if you don't smoke pot or do drugs. If you regularly do either, score -10 points.

* Subtract 3 points for every sexual partner you've had, excluding prior husbands. Me: 0.

* If you would describe yourself as a great cook, or if you aspire to be, add 3 points, or scale your score down to 0 if you can't cook.

* Are you pretty? Give yourself a score up to 5. Even if you're a "perfect 10", the top score here is only 5.

Your results:
Less than 50 points: Hey, good luck out there, I'm sure you'll find someone
50 - 89 points: Maybe sparks could fly, send an email if you like
90 - 119 points: I think we're a good fit, I'd love to get to know you
120 points: If you don't give us a chance, we'll both regret it forever

title: Half geek, half jock
text:
Hoping maybe I can find a similar mix to be involved with? 

Let's start with jock type things. UFC and the Seahawks are my sporting life. This time last week I was in Las Vegas for my 3rd UFC show in a year (actually, 6th as I type that, but the first 2 weekends were with multiple nights of fights, so 3rd TRIP to go to shows). Have gone with friends, more often than not go alone. Would be a real joy to go with someone. Honestly, even just to Vegas. Fighting doesn't need to be your thing, I'd be almost as happy just to have you on the plane with me and you going to Jersey Boys or something that night.

I train MMA about 4 nights a week. A lot of my friends/trainers are fighters. I have no desire to do it myself, but it's fun to train and get in shape (and after I messed my knee up last year hitting the bag I'm sorta restarting that process right now). Part of me is super jealous of the couples I see doing things like jiujitsu. Prefer to stick to striking cause I'd rather only be sweating on someone as I mount them if they enjoy that type of thing. ;)

Do you even need to bring up the Seahawks in Seattle? If for some reason I do, I just did. 

I also have a huge geeky streak in me. The resurgence of Star Wars has made me 8 years old again. Like many fans I became lapsed due the 3 beatings I took from the prequels. The lead up to the new one helped me rediscover my love for the originals. Saw the new one 5 times in the theaters, and each time I had a smile like an idiot on my face from start to finish (outside of the murder of a very beloved character). I'd be lying if I said I've not walked in to a Target for toothpaste and walked out with a Han Solo figure for my desk at work.

I'm also a big fan of comic books and that whole genre of entertainment. Mostly Marvel. But I'm also a big Batman fan. Still recall having a really bad flu, waking up to see a text that Affleck was going to be Batman and replying to my friend, "I don't hate it." If he's good my instant reaction was right, if he isn't, I was sick and couldn't be trusted to think straight. I think he's gonna do good, though my hopes for the film itself are rather low. 

Like most people I loved Deadpool and like the little universe Fox has with him and the X-Men on screen. But my favorite stuff is what Disney does with the Avengers universe. That new Captain America trailer coming out earlier this week made me giddy. Especially now that they can use Spider-Man and killed off those awful Andrew Garfield movies the other studio made.

The idea of a girl who would be on the same page with all this stuff would be ideal. But hey, right now I'd be happy with someone who when the new Marvel film comes out will be happy to come out for the opening night and be in to it. Or someone who just likes the idea of going to a sports bar for UFC fights or Seahawks games with me and my friends and isn't going to sit there with a sour face and later claim they were being a good sport. Incase you can tell, that might have been an experience I've had in the past.

Anyways, if any of this sounds appealing, let's chat.

title: Geeky guy seeks nerdy girl
text:
Hello everyone,

My name's Tony and I'm a Hawaiian transplant to Seattle. I grew up on the Big Island, and made the move up here about 9 years ago. I'm the IT manager for an aviation company here in Seattle (not the big one, if you were wondering). In my spare time, I can usually be found geeking out (building computers, collecting things). I'm a huge fan of all sorts of different games, and I still enjoy the "newness" of exploring a big city.

Face-to-face, I can be a little shy, at least on the first date or two. Once I'm comfortable though, I do open up and relax. When it comes to "date" activities, I am a sucker for someone who doesn't mind geeking out with me. The zoo and pub trivia are also winners in my book. Whether you're a Seattle native, or a fellow transplant, I also highly recommend Ride the Ducks and the Underground Tour.

What am I looking for? It's hard to say. That sort of thing can't be boiled down into a few concise sentences. I don't play favorites, or dismiss people just because they might be short, tall, big, small, etc. Now I'll be honest - it helps if you've played Munchkin or know what a URL is. Worst case scenario is we exchange a few emails :)

At any rate, if you've read this far, thanks for looking and have a great weekend :)

text:

Alchemy . . . "the process of taking something ordinary and turning it into something extraordinary, sometimes in a way that cannot be explained." This means I'm looking for a loving, caring, long term relationship with a single, funny, smart, educated woman with an irresistible charming personality, sense of adventure, and lots of common sense. 

When you pair up with someone and live through the day to day challenges of accepting, loving, and living with another person, you have the opportunity to create a beautiful life together out of the ordinary act of living rather than trying to "borrow" excitement, prestige, wealth, youth, or any other characteristic from the other person via "chemistry."

I am 6' tall, charismatic, broad shoulders, hazel-brown eyes, handsome, adventurous, funny, educated, sensual, cute, cultured, and a young working professional. I love traveling, languages, experiencing different cultures and food, helping others, giving back to the community, continuously learning, cooking, music, all things outdoors, keeping fit, and others. I believe that a successful relationship must have at a minimum the following elements:

1) Constant and honest communication - being vulnerable 
2) Zero lies, stealing, manipulating, trickery, or unethical behavior -- that means no white lies either
3) No screaming, violence or abuse of any kind -- there is never any reason for this.

* who wants to grow old and wrinkly together

* who has no or minimal emotional baggage

If this interests you, then to be fair, please write more than one line about yourself, share the basics (name, age, height, etc.), interests, what resonated with you, what you are looking for, what you have been doing with your life as well as where you'd like to go, any questions you have, and include a pic or two and I'll do the same.

title: I'm an open book... read chapter 1
text:
Who Am I?: 
(Chapter 1, Page 1) Creative, talented, responsive, reasonably attractive, physically fit, and acutely "modest"... In a perfect world, that's how I want to be characterized. In the real world, I'm an everyday person who has had the opportunity to experience an array of life events. I've lived to learn from some and others, I've simply learned to live with.

My interests include, but are not limited to: 
Guitar since age 15; I enjoy Karoke, and am told that Willy Nelson sounds alot like me; my music listening varies by mood and; I enjoy AM radio talk shows such as Cisco the garden guru, the guy who tries to be the legal expert, the mutual fund salesman and, good old what's her name that knows everything about computers. I'm a crossword puzzleaholic and can complete the Sunday New York Times usually before the next one comes out. I enjoy watching NFL games on TV but, don't ask me who won the Super Bowl last year. Wait a minute... hold the show... everyone knows Seattle won the Super Bowl last year but returned to lose this year (ugh). The last five minutes of a NASCAR race is perfect but, three hours of continual left turns is boring. 

In the last 2 years I have cruised in Hawaii and Mexico, been taken to the cleaners in Las Vegas and, taken road trips to Yellowstone and the Redwoods; I have learned the names of most northwest indiginous plants; I contribute to my eventual retirement by collecting state quarters and presidential dollars and, firmly believe that a quarter saved today will be worth about ten cents when I finally spend it.

Like anyone else, I'm a product of life experiences. I was raised in the Puget Sound area of Washington state and grew up as a newspaper boy, a landscaper, a Sears retail slave, and an entrepreneur from the beginning. I faked my way through high school, learned to play the guitar, had my first experience with "everlasting" love, and managed to get through the Viet Nam era. I graduated from The Evergreen State College with a degree in something I know nothing about today but, I did learn how to learn.

I moved to Alaska and built log homes for 6 years, became a general contractor, and a businessman. I couldn't tolerate the seasons, so I came home and continued building log homes for 7 more years. I moved to Wenatchee, to become a perishable commodities broker. Eight years later I moved to Mesa AZ, and successfully completed my mid life crisis. I then moved on to Santa Cruz CA and spent a couple of years remodeling a beach front hotel and to the best of my ability pretended to surf. 

Finally, I returned home again and started another construction company. In order to relax, I had a minor stroke and then recuperated. I moved on. I've developed a strong foundation of reality. I own every tool known to man kind, and I am used to a woman professing her eternal love in exchange for a new kitchen, bathroom, deck, and even a some things that are truly important.

Today, I am ready to begin a new life adventure. If you are curious, you only need ask. I want to find a person who possesses the patience to read through this essay, finds we have at least some common interests, perhaps similar experiences and, hopefully a good nature, humor, ethic, intelligence, and a positive spirit. In the past I have gotten along well with complete opposites but, that was then and we all move on. I've learned ... that I'm really not totally clear about the thing's I've learned.

Today, let's find common ground. I have not yet done the red convertible with 12 gold chains around my neck so,if you can perform an intervention on that one, my friends, family and, society in general will be forever grateful.

If you want someone who still thinks young, is funny, can cook and likes being frisky? Problem solved; I can do 75%. You will be glad to learn that I do not base my life around a Harley Davidson motorcycle nor do I even own one. I do not wear a handkerchief bandanna on my head nor will I ever send unsolicited photos of my private parts or the slowly developing balding spot on the back of my head.

I do have one very simple request from you and that is... if you decide to respond to this post please be willing to share some information about yourself. After all, this is a 2 way street and I would like to know more than the fact you have read my post. A photo would also be nice as it will provide me with a mental image of who I may be communicating with. Your compliance with these two simple requests will also demonstrate that you have at least an interest in becoming acquainted and are not just a lazy lady hoping to get an email.

Life's journey is not to to arrive at the grave safely in a well preserved body, but rather to skid in sideways, totally worn out shouting 
HOLY SH!T... WHAT A RIDE!

title: Tell me if this sounds familiar.
text:
We come on here or any other dating site/app looking for that special someone. Or maybe it's not even that special someone. Maybe we're in that dark place and we're just looking for a shimmer of light to show us the way out. We've had the relationship (love) we thought was real but like Groundhog's Day we fucked it up. Yes, we fucked it up. Sure, the other person may have hammered in the nail but it was us. We chose them in the first place. We gave them the time. We thought this time was different. We thought we'd learned from the last time. And the time before that. But we didn't. We're back to square one. 
Maybe we're a 5. Maybe we're a 10. In the end we're a zero in our minds. We got beaten down so much in the past that any compliment is seen with a pause. When those compliments add up it turns into a drug. A drug we crave over and over again. We want that validation. The meaning to it all. This person cares. But do they? Do we? You start telling yourself it's only a matter of time before it's over. You start fantasizing. Wow, imagine this. Imagine that. So and so has it made. Man, I wonder what it's like to have lust for someone. To have them lust for me. I wonder what it's like to have that intimacy. The intimacy of knowing that they'd put your needs before theirs. They'd walk over a raging lava pit just to spend 30 minutes with you and walk back across the lava to have the chance another time. 
Then the person you were with moves on. Maybe you hear about it through the rumor mill. Maybe you feel that urge to look them up on Facebook. You see a photo. A status update. And your heart sinks. Your skin feels cold. It's like you're walking the Green Mile. We've all been there. You feel pain. You feel anger. You feel regret. No amount of food, wine, tequila or porn can cover it. 
You tell yourself, "I'm going to concentrate on me. I'm going to get in shape. Figure out what I really want in life. From a relationship. I'm going to concentrate on my kid(s)." Fill in the blank because we all fit the story. Just a different birthday. That's it. Male/Female, we all are looking for that link. That link to happiness. That link to the person who makes it feel right. Where do you find it? Will you know it when you see it? Will they like you back? Will you fuck up again and be back to square one, or is this the time you find what you're meant to have?

A week, a few weeks or maybe even a few months later you think you're over them or at least dealing with it in a responsible manner. They're number is erased from your phone. You don't follow them on Facebook. Then you look at your phone and you see it. You know it when you see it. Their number. A text. It's words but it might as well be your blood. It's a text to say "I hope you're well" or something along those lines but in reality it's some BS attempt to keep the hook in your mouth from coming all the way out. They don't want to know you swam away from the boat. They want to keep you on their line. Maybe they feel guilty. Maybe they're lonely. Maybe they're with someone else but got bored and want to feel excitement again. Maybe they're just a lying sack of shit who has no business being in any semblance of a relationship. So...did you answer back or delete the text?

title: Nerdy, dorky and geeky, but that's not all!
text:
Some more useful information for our readers: THIS IS THE MEN SEEKING WOMEN SECTION, NOT THE WOMEN SEEKING MEN SECTION. I'm glad that I get some e-mails about someone interested in me, but when I find out it's a guy, it doesn't make me entirely too happy as I'm looking for a girl. Second, the dick pics. I don't want them. No one else you randomly email wants them. Keep them to yourself and show it to your special someone when and if they care to. Better yet, delete them.

I scour the posts of women seeking men looking for the type of person I would like to meet but I have yet to see a post from someone near me that has really piqued my interests. Or that when I do get the nerve to actually TRY, it's just an email sitting in their inbox that they have read or decided not to give a shit about. WITH THAT BEING SAID, hi there. :D

Your basic post would be to describe what type of person you are, let's start with that, shall we? I'm a 27 year old tall and slim person, a twig that gets blown away by the wind. (Not entirely, but that damn wind has tried its best.) I take care of myself and most of the time have since I stepped off the plane into this state. I'm also not on the talking side with my family members due to our conflicts and constant headbutting (Not that I'm a deer or an animal like that), so if you would one day want to meet my family, that's not gonna happen. The personality that I house is that of the dorky/nerdy/geeky type with a dash of chivalry. I'm a horrible liar, so I don't bother trying it. I cook, I clean, I do my own grocery shopping, sew, do the laundry and put it away. I make the perfect wife. Other things about me is that I have a job, a car, have an apartment with a roommate, pay my bills, take care of myself and look out for my roommate every once in a while.

Type of person I would hope to meet. Not necessary, but might be a bit nice. :D
Entirely, I don't have a shitton of requirements, for the reasons that I can get along with ANYONE that I deem fit to want to be around, BUT I don't want to date those who love the influence of drugs and nor am I 420 friendly. I would like to find someone with at least HALF of personality that I have. Someone that I can sit down with, know how to make them smile whenever they're sad, watch movies, play video games (FUCK YEAH), but not have to be with each other all the time. We are our own person and don't need to be joined at the sides every waking moment.

The least bit I would like at the most is someone with some common ground. Anime and video/card games, and we're perfect for each other. For an example, we are in a huge line waiting for something and I hear, "_____, I'm bored" (Keeping my name out of this.) and I would just whip out one of my old handheld gaming systems and say "Here, go catch some pokemons." Or just play a random game I have, really.

I may not be the most handsome guy out there, but I can guarantee I'm not the ugliest mofo alive. I will not change the type of person I am because I like who I am. Chances are, you've seen me out there but don't know it's me. And if you do send me an email, 9/10, I will send one back, don't worry. :>

P.S. You don't have to send a picture, because I prefer personality over looks. I'm not shallow, I'd rather you be an interesting person. :D

title: The "void"
text:
Do you ever feel you have a sort of "void" in your life...

I have been married for what seems like a long :-) time and actually happy for the most part. I do find that the utter lack of passion and excitement in my relationship and especially in the bedroom is more like a "void". I wonder is its worth missing out on something that I love and enjoy especially while I am young and full of vigor. I just turned 40, fit, in good shape, proportionate, positive, good-looking, and have a knack to please. I know a lot of men and women are in similar situations but probably fear admitting it. I have even been approached in subtle ways by women in my circle...but isn't that just too close to home and a little risky? I like the anonymity here and thought why not give it a try. I'm not looking to just jump in bed and am an NOT an undersexed freak by any stretch of imagination. I don't want to lose what I have, but really need an adventure. I want to feel the excitement of all of those firsts that come with a new partner...touch, kiss, etc. I kiss as if its the last day on earth :-) 

You should be in a similar situation. Please don't be looking to change or break anything, but have enough to lose yourself so that its a level playing field. Discretion is not negotiable! For me to venture out and take this risk, we both would have to first connect and the emotional level and then at the physical level. You should be attractive. When I say attractive I just don't mean physically. Its your personality, attitude and mind that is way more important to me than your looks. 

I'm not looking to get off one time and run. Let's get to know each other over e-mail/chat, exchange pictures if it feels right and go from there. If nothing else, the fun of getting to know someone new, even if online, is appealing. I could use a distraction and maybe we could help each other address that "void".
