title: Ladies, is this what you're looking for? (The no BS version)
text:
I think I've finally figured it out. At least to a certain extent I've grasped what a woman really wants. I get it. I really do. Took a long time but I've seen the light. A lot of heartache on both of our ends. 

1. A nice guy but not too nice. Not too needy but not closed and withdrawn. Someone who isn't stubborn and unwilling to talk about life and love. I get it now. 
2. Someone who cares about his looks and being healthy. It's really that simple.
3. Have goals and ambition beyond just how your fantasy football team does or if your softball team wins. Don't ever be just satisfied with your existence on Earth. 
4. Don't be a slob. Own more than 2 pairs of jeans and more than 2 pairs of shoes. Know how to dress. Take pride in yourself. Again, I get it. 
5. Be a man. Not a boy. Not someone who is "trying to find myself". Or "working on me". That's bullshit. There's no finding yourself. Only making yourself. 
6. Know how to rock your work in the bedroom. Read you well enough to know the nights when you want to cuddle vs. having to change the sheets in the morning. 
7. Family and friends are everything. Even if I don't like certain things about them I should just keep my mouth shut. It'll only do damage by judging anyone. As long as they love you and treat you with love and respect that should be good enough for me. Bingo
8. Money isn't everything but you're not looking to struggle. No woman wants to worry about money. Don't let money burn a hole in your pocket either. It's okay to save. Just don't be a tight ass. 
9. They're exes for a reason. Less you talk about them the better. You hate talking about them just as much as I do. If there's kids involved that's one thing but don't harp and worse yet don't compare. Be the best dad you can be. 
10. Without trust any relationship is toast. TOAST. You always find out. Even if it's something very simply and platonic but honest. It's not worth hiding anything. Same goes for you. Read you loud and clear.
11. The grass isn't always greener somewhere else. Take care of the grass you have right in front of you and life and love can be awesome. Keep watering and tending to it. If not there's someone else who will turn that brown lawn into a masterpiece. 
12. Do things you don't really like to do. That's what you do for your partner. Do them and don't bitch about it before, during and after. 
13. You'll remember my mistakes forever but you can and will forgive. That's what women do. Just don't let it get out of hand and be honest. 
14. You're a lot freakier than you let on. It's my job to open up the vault. 
15. Never, ever take it all for granted because one text or phone call can end it all, forever. 

If you read this I'd just like to say thank you. If you choose to respond I thank you ahead of time and just know that it means a lot.

title: atypically amorous (& hot) SWM dom ISO younger, 420 friendly hwp sub
text:
Hi. I regret to inform you that I am one of the more improbably intelligent and talented people you are going to meet here, or anywhere else for that matter. This is not a statement of pride, it's a statement of fact. I am an unconventionally educated musical polymath who is an experienced Yoga instructor that started practicing martial arts when I was 8. I am also a writer who is about to publish what will undoubtably be a highly controversial book You are reading this here because meeting people in person is effectively impossible in Seattle and I have zero faith in dating apps or the opportunistic players that make up the vast majority of their "users". 

To put the picture in some kind of perspective, I am 5'11", 165#'s, athletic/average build with green eyes and thick brown hair long enough to tie back. I have moderate facial hair, minimal body hair, and am clean. I also look ten or more years younger than my age suggests. I don't smoke, don't really drink, don't do drugs (aside from being 420 friendly) and am STD free. I have a car and my own place in North Seattle, and prefer to host. 

Prior "non-vanilla" or related sexual experience on your part is not at all necessary, but any that you do have will be appreciated. 

I am experienced in this sort of relationship, and am presently in a near ideal place in my life for something more interesting than a one night stand, fling, or some casually convenient FWB thing. I am less concerned about starting something "serious" as I am initiating something steady. That said, I am open to further developments happening here.

I think sexual specifics are best discussed in a more private format. Generally speaking, beyond the usual amorous activities you should be open minded and interested in trying new things and open to the prospect of following my lead, but not blindly or without your input. Despite being on the more dominant side, I am not into pain intensive activities, aside from including enough hair pulling, spankings and assorted manhandling in the mix to keep you on your toes. ;) 

In the interest of full disclosure, I should mention being "atypically amorous" does not mean that I am excessively emotional. What it does mean is that my sexual drive (and stamina) are consistently higher than most people. And, oddly enough, I am multi-orgasmic as well. Again, these are not statements of pride, but facts that have been an issue in more than one previous relationship. If you are someone who appreciates regular and sustained sexual attention you are unlikely to find a more ideally equipped activity partner on here or anywhere else, for that matter.

As for you, you still reading this, being STD free and falling somewhere on the average-athletic-petite HWP spectrum is a pretty good start. Curves in those contexts are appreciated. Obviously, there is a lot more to you than that and assume that I am very interested in hearing anything more about yourself that you want to share. 

In your response please include an accurate self-description, including your present neighborhood (or city) of residence in addition to any other things you think I should know about you. I know it can be intensely awkward writing someone online, so don't feel like you have to impress me with witty banter or sophisticated prose at all. 

To weed out the scammers and spam bots, please describe what you are presently wearing in the subject of your first message. Any messages that are not in the indicated format will be flagged and deleted. Any who do get in touch will find that I give great...message, among other things. Hit the "respond" button and start typing, missy. ;)

title: I'm lonely, you're lonely. Work with me.
text:
People always post here about how awesome their lives are, and how they're looking for a significant other to just be the icing on their cake, the rice underneath their tikka masala. Everybody claims to be so stable, so independent, so overflowing with success and happiness and friends that you wonder why they're on here in the first place.

Let's start being honest. We're here because we're lonely, and being lonely sucks. Being lonely is not something to be ashamed of. Being lonely is more or less the default state of today's world. It's not how life is "supposed" to be, but it happens. Technology isolates us. You're reading these words sitting alone in your apartment. You could be talking to me at QFC, helping me pick out shallots for tonight's chicken marsala. (Shallots are pretty easy to pick out, aren't they?)

I'm lonely. I'd prefer doing stuff with a cute, clever, curious female around instead of flying solo all the time. Of course I have friends, but seriously? Friends are not a cure to loneliness, not the kind of loneliness I feel, the kind of loneliness I know you're feeling. 

Write me a damn email. Talk to me about how you feel and what you're looking for. Tell me a bit about yourself. Myself, I'm somewhat of an intellectual, I enjoy outside activities, and everybody who has ever hung around me describes me as "the funny guy".

title: A Realistic D/s relationship
text:
I hope to meet a submissive or submissive-curious woman for a mutually satisfying relationship. This relationship could end up long-term but I have found starting off with realistic expectations is the best approach. That means no pressure, just getting to know each other as a starting point. I expect anything of substance to happen over time. Your experience with BDSM or kink does not matter as much as your sincerity in wanting to explore. I have learned over time but in no way am I am expert or have an attitude or anything of that nature. I know what I like and probably so do you. It just takes the right combination of circumstances to make it work. 

As far as kink goes, it takes time to figure out the best way to cross that line. I'm not a horny toad so sex is not the first thing on my mind. I dont even need sex to be honest with you. It just happens. anything else feels forced or contrived. The build up towards intimacy is much more appealing than rushing into it. A strong emotional connection takes effort and appreciating time spent together, developing interests, being able to talk about anything as friends as well as partners (if it comes to that). It won't happen overnight but it starts with acknowledging the desire to explore each other. Im not openly dominant in public so knowing the difference is important. Being open about everything up front saves a lot of confusion and awkward moments later if things click. If it doesn't, maybe we'll have some fun trying. 

The important thing is to approach this as any relationship, see where things go, find out if chemistry is there. Do we have anything else in common? Is it natural to feel comfortable with each other, that sort of thing. 

I am 31, single, have no kids or no ex, mentally balanced and socially adjusted.

Let's take it from there.

title: Somewhere in-between NSA and dating
text:
Robot sex with people I know nothing about doesn't excite me. I'm not interested in a relationship that's serious, but I would like to casually date somebody around my age. We'll know enough about each other and have enough of a spark to make it worthwhile.

In the animal kingdom, species fall plainly in one of two camps: pair-bonders and tournament species. The former find one mate and stay with them for life and there is some emotional bond to keep them together, the latter will basically fuck whoever demonstrates the most evolutionary fitness (strength, agility, size of their red mark on their wings, whatever their standard is). People are quite unique in that we fall somewhere on this spectrum. I'm a pair bonder with tournament species tendencies, but not interested in being serious relationships for a bit.

I'm 25, interested in radical politics, and think life is about more than having a job or pursuing standard socially-set goals like marriage, kids, etc. I think life is too short and too rich to be concerned with what I see as such relatively silly pursuits. I'm poly and vegan, but don't care what you eat or what your typical relationship style has been. I'm a total sapiosexual and like to surround myself with intelligent people who have their own, unique view of the world. I have a huge soft spot for nerdy girls. I do have a job of course, and I have my shit together more than most people I know. Though if you don't, that's fine with me. Life is hard and sometimes it wins

Logistics: I can host and have transportation, play safe, and am clean.

Tell me a bit about yourself and let's go from there, excited to meet you : )

title: I'm an open book... read chapter 1
text:
Who Am I?: 
(Chapter 1, Page 1) Creative, talented, responsive, reasonably attractive, physically fit, and acutely "modest"... In a perfect world, that's how I want to be characterized. In the real world, I'm an everyday person who has had the opportunity to experience an array of life events. I've lived to learn from some and others, I've simply learned to live with.

My interests include, but are not limited to: 
Guitar since age 15; I enjoy Karoke, and am told that Willy Nelson sounds alot like me; my music listening varies by mood and; I enjoy AM radio talk shows such as Cisco the garden guru, the guy who tries to be the legal expert, the mutual fund salesman and, good old what's her name that knows everything about computers. I'm a crossword puzzleaholic and can complete the Sunday New York Times usually before the next one comes out. I enjoy watching NFL games on TV but, don't ask me who won the Super Bowl last year. Wait a minute... hold the show... everyone knows Seattle won the Super Bowl last year but returned to lose this year (ugh). The last five minutes of a NASCAR race is perfect but, three hours of continual left turns is boring. 

In the last 2 years I have cruised in Hawaii and Mexico, been taken to the cleaners in Las Vegas and, taken road trips to Yellowstone and the Redwoods; I have learned the names of most northwest indiginous plants; I contribute to my eventual retirement by collecting state quarters and presidential dollars and, firmly believe that a quarter saved today will be worth about ten cents when I finally spend it.

Like anyone else, I'm a product of life experiences. I was raised in the Puget Sound area of Washington state and grew up as a newspaper boy, a landscaper, a Sears retail slave, and an entrepreneur from the beginning. I faked my way through high school, learned to play the guitar, had my first experience with "everlasting" love, and managed to get through the Viet Nam era. I graduated from The Evergreen State College with a degree in something I know nothing about today but, I did learn how to learn.

I moved to Alaska and built log homes for 6 years, became a general contractor, and a businessman. I couldn't tolerate the seasons, so I came home and continued building log homes for 7 more years. I moved to Wenatchee, to become a perishable commodities broker. Eight years later I moved to Mesa AZ, and successfully completed my mid life crisis. I then moved on to Santa Cruz CA and spent a couple of years remodeling a beach front hotel and to the best of my ability pretended to surf. 

Finally, I returned home again and started another construction company. In order to relax, I had a minor stroke and then recuperated. I moved on. I've developed a strong foundation of reality. I own every tool known to man kind, and I am used to a woman professing her eternal love in exchange for a new kitchen, bathroom, deck, and even a some things that are truly important.

Today, I am ready to begin a new life adventure. If you are curious, you only need ask. I want to find a person who possesses the patience to read through this essay, finds we have at least some common interests, perhaps similar experiences and, hopefully a good nature, humor, ethic, intelligence, and a positive spirit. In the past I have gotten along well with complete opposites but, that was then and we all move on. I've learned ... that I'm really not totally clear about the thing's I've learned.

Today, let's find common ground. I have not yet done the red convertible with 12 gold chains around my neck so,if you can perform an intervention on that one, my friends, family and, society in general will be forever grateful.

If you want someone who still thinks young, is funny, can cook and likes being frisky? Problem solved; I can do 75%. You will be glad to learn that I do not base my life around a Harley Davidson motorcycle nor do I even own one. I do not wear a handkerchief bandanna on my head nor will I ever send unsolicited photos of my private parts or the slowly developing balding spot on the back of my head.

I do have one very simple request from you and that is... if you decide to respond to this post please be willing to share some information about yourself. After all, this is a 2 way street and I would like to know more than the fact you have read my post. A photo would also be nice as it will provide me with a mental image of who I may be communicating with. Your compliance with these two simple requests will also demonstrate that you have at least an interest in becoming acquainted and are not just a lazy lady hoping to get an email.

Life's journey is not to to arrive at the grave safely in a well preserved body, but rather to skid in sideways, totally worn out shouting 
HOLY SH!T... WHAT A RIDE!

title: Childless by Choice, Seeking the Same
text:
It honestly seems like everyone has kids these days. I have nothing against kids. I like kids, but I just don't want any myself. I used to want kids when I was younger. I took care of my younger sister ever since she was a baby. So I know how hard it is to take care of and raise children. Now I just don't think it's for me. It almost seems like I'm a rarity; a 34 year-old man that doesn't have any kids. Dating has become even more complicated these days. At least it has for me. Almost every woman I meet, already has at least one kid. I have nothing against the single mothers out there. I have met some very nice ones. But because I don't want kids, it definitely shrinks the pool of available women. 

So here I am. A single and childless man, seeking a single and childless woman for a relationship. I want to have a serious relationship with a great woman that will hopefully lead to marriage. I have a good job, but still have more dreams and goals that I want to achieve. I'm looking for a woman in a similar situation. Whether she's working or going to school or both. I would hope she has her own goals and dreams that she wants to achieve. Maybe we could help each other to realize our dreams. I want to get married and have a beautiful home with my wife. I want us to be able to spoil each other and give each other everything we want. I like to travel and want to do much more of it. I want to be able to see the world with my significant other and share extraordinary moments with her. I want to be able to take vacations on a whim or take a road trip on a weekend just because we wanted to get out of town. I don't think these things are possible when you have kids. Simply going to the store with a child can be a mission. That's not for me. I want to worry only about my wife and myself. 

I know this way of thinking may seem selfish or may even offend some people. But that is just how I picture my life and how I hope to live it. I'm looking for the woman that feels just like I do. She understands my stance on children and hopes for the same future as I do. I know she is out there somewhere, now I just have to find her. I am open to age and race, but be somewhat close to my age range. She should have her life together or be working towards realizing her goals. 

If you think you are the kind of woman I'm looking for, please message me and tell me about yourself. I will gladly tell you more about myself and send you a picture as well. I hope to hear from you soon.

Hey there, thanks for taking the time to click on my ad. Here's what I am hoping to find on here, of course you don't have to be exactly what I am looking for, so close enough is fine! haha. 

I would like to find a really nice sweet girl, down to earth, has her responsibilities in order, and knows what she wants out of life. I am a great listener, and can keep a conversation going for hours if the chemistry is there. I have a lot of hobbies that I am into, and I am pretty much up for anything. Anyway, if you liked what you read and are you are interested in getting to know me some more, then please by all means, send me a message and don't forget to include a picture of yourself and let's see what happens. title: Jazzinator
text:
The science of love

When do you know if you fancy someone? What does love do to your brain chemicals, and is falling in love just nature's way to keep our species alive?

We call it love. It feels like love. But the most exhilarating of all human emotions is probably nature's beautiful way of keeping the human species alive and reproducing.

With an irresistible cocktail of chemicals, our brain entices us to fall in love. We believe we're choosing a partner. But we may merely be the happy victims of nature's lovely plan.


It's not what you say...
Psychologists have shown it takes between 90 seconds and 4 minutes to decide if you fancy someone.
Research has shown this has little to do with what is said, rather
55% is through body language
38% is the tone and speed of their voice
Only 7% is through what they say



The 3 stages of love
Helen Fisher of Rutgers University in the States has proposed 3 stages of love -- lust, attraction and attachment. Each stage might be driven by different hormones and chemicals.

Stage 1: Lust
This is the first stage of love and is driven by the sex hormones testosterone and oestrogen -- in both men and women.


Stage 2: Attraction
This is the amazing time when you are truly love-struck and can think of little else. Scientists think that three main neurotransmitters are involved in this stage; adrenaline, dopamine and serotonin.

Adrenaline
The initial stages of falling for someone activates your stress response, increasing your blood levels of adrenalin and cortisol. This has the charming effect that when you unexpectedly bump into your new love, you start to sweat, your heart races and your mouth goes dry.

Dopamine
Helen Fisher asked newly 'love struck' couples to have their brains examined and discovered they have high levels of the neurotransmitter dopamine. This chemical stimulates 'desire and reward' by triggering an intense rush of pleasure. It has the same effect on the brain as taking cocaine!

Fisher suggests "couples often show the signs of surging dopamine: increased energy, less need for sleep or food, focused attention and exquisite delight in smallest details of this novel relationship" .


Serotonin
And finally, serotonin. One of love's most important chemicals that may explain why when you're falling in love, your new lover keeps popping into your thoughts.

Does love change the way you think?
A landmark experiment in Pisa, Italy showed that early love (the attraction phase) really changes the way you think.


Dr Donatella Marazziti, a psychiatrist at the University of Pisa advertised for twenty couples who'd been madly in love for less than six months. She wanted to see if the brain mechanisms that cause you to constantly think about your lover, were related to the brain mechanisms of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

By analysing blood samples from the lovers, Dr Marazitti discovered that serotonin levels of new lovers were equivalent to the low serotonin levels of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder patients.

Love needs to be blind
Newly smitten lovers often idealise their partner, magnifying their virtues and explaining away their flaws says Ellen Berscheid, a leading researcher on the psychology of love.

New couples also exalt the relationship itself. "It's very common to think they have a relationship that's closer and more special than anyone else's". Psychologists think we need this rose-tinted view. It makes us want to stay together to enter the next stage of love -- attachment.

Stage 3: Attachment
Attachment is the bond that keeps couples together long enough for them to have and raise children. Scientists think there might be two major hormones involved in this feeling of attachment; oxytocin and vasopressin.

Oxytocin - The cuddle hormone

Oxytocin is a powerful hormone released by men and women during orgasm. 
It probably deepens the feelings of attachment and makes couples feel much closer to one another after they have had sex. The theory goes that the more sex a couple has, the deeper their bond becomes. 
Oxytocin also seems to help cement the strong bond between mum and baby and is released during childbirth. It is also responsible for a mum's breast automatically releasing milk at the mere sight or sound of her young baby.

Diane Witt, assistant professor of psychology from New York has showed that if you block the natural release of oxytocin in sheep and rats, they reject their own young.

Conversely, injecting oxytocin into female rats who've never had sex, caused them to fawn over another female's young, nuzzling the pups and protecting them as if they were their own.



Vasopressin
Vasopressin is another important hormone in the long-term commitment stage and is released after sex.

Vasopressin (also called anti-diuretic hormone) works with your kidneys to control thirst. Its potential role in long-term relationships was discovered when scientists looked at the prairie vole.

Prairie voles indulge in far more sex than is strictly necessary for the purposes of reproduction. They also -- like humans - form fairly stable pair-bonds.

When male prairie voles were given a drug that suppresses the effect of vasopressin, the bond with their partner deteriorated immediately as they lost their devotion and failed to protect their partner from new suitors.


And finally . . . how to fall in love
Find a complete stranger.
Reveal to each other intimate details about your lives for half an hour.
Then, stare deeply into each other's eyes without talking for four minutes.

York psychologist, Professor Arthur Arun, has been studying why people fall in love.
He asked his subjects to carry out the above 3 steps and found that many of his couples felt deeply attracted after the 34 minute experiment. Two of his subjects later got married.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.

Anais Nin

There are two basic motivating forces: fear and love. When we are afraid, we pull back from life. When we are in love, we open to all that life has to offer with passion, excitement, and acceptance. We need to learn to love ourselves first, in all our glory and our imperfections. If we cannot love ourselves, we cannot fully open to our ability to love others or our potential to create. Evolution and all hopes for a better world rest in the fearlessness and open-hearted vision of people who embrace life.

John Lennon

title: Exceptional SWM for amazing lady - any race, for LTR, marriage, family
text:
Hello, 

I am writing this posting on Craigslist, knowing that the chances are small that I'll find what I'm looking for, because small chances are better than none at all. I simply want someone who brings the same things to a relationship that I bring. So, let me tell you a little about that. 

I am a tall, fit, attractive Caucasian gentleman, with a college degree and a professional career. I'm a good guy and I've done a lot of interesting things in my life. The only thing I really want is a relationship that leads to marriage and a happy family. I grew up in a traditional family and would like to have the same...to me, that means raising your own children instead of paying someone else to do it for you. To that end, I'd like to meet a woman who would like to be a mother to her children, at least until they are in school. After they're in school, I'd support whatever path you wanted to take, be it homemaker or career, and would be equally proud of you either way. 

Things I care about in a woman that I'd be dating:
- Same values and goals in life
- Intellect (pay attention here - you need to be smart)
- Desire to work on a relationship through the difficult times
- Self-esteem and discipline to keep yourself healthy - i.e. slender and/or fit
- Good work ethic

Things I don't care about:
- Height
- College degree (but like I said, intellect is key)
- If you have children
- Race

I would love to hear from anyone who has read through this post and knows they'd be a good match for everything I've talked about. Please tell me some things about yourself - i.e. the same type of information I've shared. I will gladly send pictures early in our communication, and naturally expect the same courtesy from you. To help me avoid all of the junk email that gets sent via CL, please re-read the first sentence of my posting, and in the title of your email, answer this question - what is better than none at all? 

I hope we find each other!

title: The End of Married Celibacy...
text:
I know this is a very sensitive and delicate subject to talk about, but here we are at this awkward juncture of our lives.

Like me, you miss being touched, wanted, needed... 

Like me, you have waffled back and forth about whether or not to test the waters and pursue what it is you are missing. This is something you're not accustomed to doing. Neither am I.

Like me, you don't want to leave your spouse, but you do have your needs and you know all too well that at this point they are just not going to be met...

I am a 55 year old, married white man... looking to form a very special and exclusive bond based on our chemistry. A secret place between us where we touch each other, not only in the physical sense, but in ways that we haven't been touched in a very long time, or perhaps to touch each other in ways we might not have experienced before, physically, intellectually and emotionally.

What I'm looking for is an attraction based on getting to know one another. Ever meet a man, be it at the grocery store, coffee shop, library or anywhere... someone you run into frequently? At first, you might not entertain any romantic or erotic notions. But, as you get to know this man better, you find there's a lot to like, and suddenly you find yourself open to the idea of a liaison, perhaps fantasizing about it, if only he would make the first move. I'm talking about something like that. And I hope it makes sense.

I'm interested in character, and in ... you. To learn about you. Your challenges and your triumphs. What has molded you into the beautiful, mature woman that you are.

I want to feel an excitement based on the mutual desire in our eyes.

And when that enchanting moment happens . . . wow!
It's powerful and intense, because of how well we got to know one another, and now we consummate the attraction in a beautiful moment in time.

Some people call it mind-blowing sex, but again it's all based on chemistry, and attraction.

I find women of all races, shapes, and sizes beautiful. I know from experience that real beauty comes from within. That in itself, is a treasure that money can't buy. 

I probably have a better shot of winning the Mega Millions lottery then finding you, but given a choice, I'd rather find you than win the lottery.

I know there's an overwhelming amount of cardboard cut-outs here on the CL universe, but if you are the one I'm looking for, I hope you will step out of that artificial cyber world and shine with how real and genuine you are.

If what I wrote resonates with you and you find yourself in a similar situation and looking for the same thing and you sense a potential connection please reply.

If chemistry ensues, then perhaps we can meet for coffee and see if the spark is real...

title: Girlfriend Potential Test
text:
Instructions: Please answer the questions below as directed in each section. You will be marked for grammar, spelling, cleverness, creativity and boob-size. Please keep in mind that while this is not an application for a job, your performance on this test will be a reflection of your ability to achieve certain positions once out in the real world. When the clock strikes the hour, you may begin. You have sixty minutes to complete the test. 

Section One: Multiple Choice (Answer All, 5 points)


When submitting answers via email, please paste the question and then your answer selection beside it. 

Q1. Six months into our relationship, I go away to a tropical location with my family for a week over Christmas. This vacation was planned as a family event two years prior to meeting you. This is: 
a) A great opportunity to get some things done without me around. 
b) A great opportunity to attempt to sleep with my college roommate and/or my boss. 
c) A sign that you are probably just a casual thing that I could toss aside at any given moment despite the fact I bought you probably the most thoughtful gift you've ever received and written you a letter for every day that I'll be gone, inciting you to 'Go on the Defensive.' 
d) Occasion to have a sexy dinner at home the night before I leave, and a mini 'welcome home' party when I get back that?s guest list is just you, me, a bottle of wine and a pack of condoms. 

Q2. We've talked every night for eight days (not including the dinner/opera show I took you to on Saturday night that was followed by possibly your worst performance in bed ever, or the Monday night that I came over and we spent the evening making Rachel Ray recipes and watching Heroes followed by the best oral sex I've ever given you), with conversation time averaging about an hour per night. On a Thursday night, when on a deadline, I express a need to get off the phone so I can finish some work and go to bed at a reasonable hour. You: 
a) Express your feelings of devotion in three words or less, then and quickly say goodbye after confirming plans for tomorrow night are still on. 
b) Say goodbye, but then immediately begin talking about something that we hadn't discussed as thoroughly as is scientifically, legally or religiously possible two nights prior. 
c) Take that as a sign that I'm abandoning you, and begin to point out that because of it I have commitment issues, that you're clearly not my priority, and then cry. 
d) Say goodbye, but manage to do it with such menace and venom that I stay on the phone for another three silence filled hours, broken only by fits of gentle weeping and suicide threats. 

Q3. I'm throwing change at your cleavage, which is readily on display in that loose fitting tank top you wear around my place on Sundays after brunch. Do you:
a) Wing the largest of the coins at my head, with an evil glare and then refuse to speak to me for the rest of the day. 
b) Encourage my behavior, and allow me to purchase Afternoon Delights from you at discount prices. 
c) Cry. 
d) Cry and pick a fight with me, taking my actions as a total lack of respect for you and then begin to point out that because of it I have commitment issues, that you're clearly not my priority, and then cry some more. 


Q4. We're having a fight. You: 
a) Throw me out of your apartment, then thirty minutes later send 17 texts and attempt to call 13 times in the space of six minutes. 
b) Give me space when the discussion gets too heated for rational thought, and redress your complaints in a calm manner when we've both had a chance to cool down. 
c) Flip me the bird. 
d) Wail on my junk. 
e) both c and d 
f) realize that the fight is about nothing, and begin creating fictional problems and make wild accusations about my obsession with material goods and having a wandering eye. 
g) f, then d, then c. 

Q5. I play [video games OR tabletop gaming OR fantasy football]. You: 
a) Want to join in, because it looks like hella fun. 
b) Leave me to it, in the hopes that I'll leave you a few things to participate in on your own. 
c) Attempt to get me to quit, and use tactics like nagging, vandalism and emotional sabotage as an effective campaign against what you call my 'nerdy addiction.' 
d) c, but also include deriding me to your friends. 

Section Two: True or False (Answer All, 10 points)


When submitting answers via email, please and paste the question and then your answer selection beside it. 

Q1. Rationale and Reason are the same thing. 

Q2. A cheerleader AND/OR schoolgirl outfit is a wardrobe must. 

Q3. Talking in your 'cute voice' just before you put my balls in my mouth is sexy. 

Q4. Learning body language and communication cues is important. 

Q5. 'Anchorman' and 'Superbad' are hilarious movies. 

Q6. "But it's cute when I do it" should be a legally viable defense. 

Q7. Chest hair is gross. 

Q8. Bono is probably the most important political figure of our generation. 

Q9. Sex is an important part of a relationship, and should be had frequently, often, whenever possible - within moderation, of course. 

Q10. A relationship is metaphorically a two way street. So is your butt. 

Section Three: Short Essay. (Answer ONE, 5 points)


Please select one of the following questions and answer it as fully as time will allow. Please try and be as descriptive as possible, and where applicable, come up with at least TWO convincing arguments to support your case. Arguments must be backed up with cited evidence, not anecdotal perspective. 


Q1. If I was a crime-fighting vigilante by night, what efforts would you make to support my cause about the rising threat of evil in this city? 

Q2. Please come up with a convincing game-plan for having me come shopping with you, keeping in mind my retail oriented attention span is about twelve minutes, and I am prone to wandering after flashing lights and shiny things. 

Q3. Please argue why you are (do) or are not (do not): 'Down to Earth', 'Have a sense of humor' and 'Laid back'. Bonus if you can include evidence to confirm that you truly do avoid 'head games.' 

Please submit answers via the email link provided. Please also keep a of this test and your answers to submit to future suitors for reference. Remember to ensure your name, number and bra size are clearly written at the top of your paper, and don't forget to attach a photo (3/4 length or full).

title: IS SOMEONE OR SOMETHING LIKE THIS EVEN POSSIBLE?
text: As I read other ads posted on CL everyone seems to be seeking something or someone. It is usually either for a long term or short term relationship, a friend to walk your dog with or it is someone just wanting some physical attention. What about the in between stuff... what about just a genuine connection with the opposite sex. Someone that you enjoy talking with, or you are attracted to and not just looks but attitude, personality, kindess or brains? yeah being smart, someone you enjoy because they are smart or have nice things to say about people and you enjoy the positive feelings or vibe they give, maybe you have a void in your life that they can fill but other than that you are completely happy with all other aspects of life or your partner. Another thing I have noticed is many, many people are very shallow. I tried starting a conversation with someone, just like you would with a stranger. I said "Hello how are you? and asked her if she had ever been married" she responded "No" and I said "Well it is nice to see that there are people that still believe in marriage" because she had mentioned in her ad that she wanted to be married someday. Her next response was "Got a picture" I thought uh... Yeah doesn't everyone lol but to be honest I really just wanted a genuine conversation to see if we could communicate as normal humans and see if we had an intellectual connection. Don't get me wrong physical attraction is very important but you do you really think you can fully gauge someone by a picture. Anyways I didn't want to make this a diatribe just something I noticed :) Is it possible for people of the opposite sex to have a connection, care about someone, have a special place for them in their heart, sexual, emotional or intellectually connected without being in a traditional relationship. Someone that you just know that no matter who you are with or where you are at in life they will be there to fill the loneliness or desire for someone special? Something built with total trust, respect and loyalty to one another no matter what. Eternal bond. Knowing that they would never expose or humiliate that person or use any confidential feelings that were spoken unguarded and unjudged between the 2 aginst one another. You know that you could open up to that person and they would hold it close to the heart and lock it away to protect you not use it against you to hurt you. And you wonder why? Because that is your special partner. Maybe the connection would be called a Soul Mate? Idk... I just know my thoughts. Your thoughts are welcome...

title: In the end, love is about loving an imperfect person imperfectly
text:
SWM, 52 here, weigh 225-ish, 5 ft 11, never married, and no kids (that I know of) either :) Debt free, have a reliable car, and work for myself. Just wish there was a sincere, patient lady that could make me feel like a human being again.

In the end, love is about loving an imperfect person imperfectly, but with all your heart. Not sure I will ever find what it is I believe I need. A strong woman (spiritually and emotionally), who appreciates being wanted and needed by someone. Not a doormat here by any means, by definitely want a lady to have the equal role she deserves in a relationship......

I want someone I can fall in love with- not someone who will love me for any one thing, but all of me, as I would love all of her. Someone who will love their partner for who they are. I know what love is not- sex. That is a vital part and the fruit, I feel, of a loving relationship, but far too many put the cart before the horse. Too many people (not just men, I might add), tend to forget that love is something that begins ABOVE the waistline, not below it. In the end that only leads to heartbreak and disappointment, because a relationship based purely on physical attraction or activity is really a relationship based on selfishness. With that, the principal trait that I desire from a potential friend/partner is above all, sincerity and honesty.

It does not matter to me what she looks like, or what she has done, just be upfront and honest about it. I want to have someone to settle down with, that I will always be there for her, as she is there for me. I want a woman whose strengths compliment her weaknesses. One who is not perfect and whose imperfections are what makes her the whole woman that she is. We may not always understand it, but sometimes our imperfections are part of what gives us the positive qualities, i.e., you would not have the positive without the negative. That said, I will repeat what I said earlier- I want someone whom I can fall in love with. Looking forward to hearing from you :)

I'm a single, fit guy with my adult life in order. In my 40's but mistaken for younger, great job, nice house, fun car (and a truck) who doesn't smoke (okay with others as long as not around me) drinks very moderately, no drugs and has never seen the inside of a jail cell. I love sex with the biggest thrill for me seeing my partner pleased. Yes, that's a huge turn on for me. As is kissing.

The issue seems to be that I'm not ready for anything too serious right now, but do want the friend part as well. Going out and doing things together, snuggling on the couch, dinners with long conversations and all of that. Wrapped around all of this are amazing hours naked together pleasing and being pleased with breaks for cuddling and laughing before getting worked up again.

That all sounds amazing, but it doesn't take long for the insane 'you didn't text back withing 5 minutes' and the 'what do you mean you need a night to yourself' to start. When things are forced and rushed, that's a red flag for me.

Frankly, all of this may be my fault. It's in my nature to show affection and concern. I warm up and develop feelings quickly up to a certain point that seems to be misunderstood for more. 

So, if you are missing intimacy, sex and sensuality AND companionship and friendship but can let things get to that point and stay there for a bit, I would love to hear from you. Things may develop into more (that would be wonderful) or they frankly may not (which is also good).

Part of all of this is the understanding that we may even seek more of a deeper relationship elsewhere. If that happens for you, frankly I will be happy for you and hope that even if the physical aspects end, we are still good friends. Of course I would expect the same thing.

I've even tried to date women in Poly relationships (I have been in wonderful poly relationships in the past) but those have also gone off the rails as those women weren't really poly, but were having problems in their marriage. That was all kinds of drama!

If any of this rambling is understandable, or if you simply have some advice for me, I would love to hear from you. Ultimately, I'm looking for friends (being a rather dominant man, I tend to get along better with women) and hopefully sexual partners.

Thanks for reading and I do hope to get some responses.

title: The Girlfriend Test.....
text:
Instructions: Please answer the questions below as directed in each section. You will be marked for grammar, spelling, cleverness, creativity and boob-size. Please keep in mind that while this is not an application for a job, your performance on this test will be a reflection of your ability to achieve certain positions once out in the real world. When the clock strikes the hour, you may begin. You have sixty minutes to complete the test. 

Section One: Multiple Choice (Answer All, 5 points)


When submitting answers via email, please paste the question and then your answer selection beside it. 

Q1. Six months into our relationship, I go away to a tropical location with my family for a week over Christmas. This vacation was planned as a family event two years prior to meeting you. This is: 
a) A great opportunity to get some things done without me around. 
b) A great opportunity to attempt to sleep with my college roommate and/or my boss. 
c) A sign that you are probably just a casual thing that I could toss aside at any given moment despite the fact I bought you probably the most thoughtful gift you've ever received and written you a letter for every day that I'll be gone, inciting you to 'Go on the Defensive.' 
d) Occasion to have a sexy dinner at home the night before I leave, and a mini 'welcome home' party when I get back that?s guest list is just you, me, a bottle of wine and a pack of condoms. 

Q2. We've talked every night for eight days (not including the dinner/opera show I took you to on Saturday night that was followed by possibly your worst performance in bed ever, or the Monday night that I came over and we spent the evening making Rachel Ray recipes and watching Heroes followed by the best oral sex I've ever given you), with conversation time averaging about an hour per night. On a Thursday night, when on a deadline, I express a need to get off the phone so I can finish some work and go to bed at a reasonable hour. You: 
a) Express your feelings of devotion in three words or less, then and quickly say goodbye after confirming plans for tomorrow night are still on. 
b) Say goodbye, but then immediately begin talking about something that we hadn't discussed as thoroughly as is scientifically, legally or religiously possible two nights prior. 
c) Take that as a sign that I'm abandoning you, and begin to point out that because of it I have commitment issues, that you're clearly not my priority, and then cry. 
d) Say goodbye, but manage to do it with such menace and venom that I stay on the phone for another three silence filled hours, broken only by fits of gentle weeping and suicide threats. 

Q3. I'm throwing change at your cleavage, which is readily on display in that loose fitting tank top you wear around my place on Sundays after brunch. Do you:
a) Wing the largest of the coins at my head, with an evil glare and then refuse to speak to me for the rest of the day. 
b) Encourage my behavior, and allow me to purchase Afternoon Delights from you at discount prices. 
c) Cry. 
d) Cry and pick a fight with me, taking my actions as a total lack of respect for you and then begin to point out that because of it I have commitment issues, that you're clearly not my priority, and then cry some more. 


Q4. We're having a fight. You: 
a) Throw me out of your apartment, then thirty minutes later send 17 texts and attempt to call 13 times in the space of six minutes. 
b) Give me space when the discussion gets too heated for rational thought, and redress your complaints in a calm manner when we've both had a chance to cool down. 
c) Flip me the bird. 
d) Wail on my junk. 
e) both c and d 
f) realize that the fight is about nothing, and begin creating fictional problems and make wild accusations about my obsession with material goods and having a wandering eye. 
g) f, then d, then c. 

Q5. I play [video games OR tabletop gaming OR fantasy football]. You: 
a) Want to join in, because it looks like hella fun. 
b) Leave me to it, in the hopes that I'll leave you a few things to participate in on your own. 
c) Attempt to get me to quit, and use tactics like nagging, vandalism and emotional sabotage as an effective campaign against what you call my 'nerdy addiction.' 
d) c, but also include deriding me to your friends. 

Section Two: True or False (Answer All, 10 points)


When submitting answers via email, please and paste the question and then your answer selection beside it. 

Q1. Rationale and Reason are the same thing. 

Q2. A cheerleader AND/OR schoolgirl outfit is a wardrobe must. 

Q3. Talking in your 'cute voice' just before you put my balls in your mouth is sexy. 

Q4. Learning body language and communication cues is important. 

Q5. 'Anchorman' and 'Superbad' are hilarious movies. 

Q6. "But it's cute when I do it" should be a legally viable defense. 

Q7. Chest hair is gross. 

Q8. Bono is probably the most important political figure of our generation. 

Q9. Sex is an important part of a relationship, and should be had frequently, often, whenever possible - within moderation, of course. 

Q10. A relationship is metaphorically a two way street. So is your butt. 

Section Three: Short Essay. (Answer ONE, 5 points)


Please select one of the following questions and answer it as fully as time will allow. Please try and be as descriptive as possible, and where applicable, come up with at least TWO convincing arguments to support your case. Arguments must be backed up with cited evidence, not anecdotal perspective. 


Q1. If I was a crime-fighting vigilante by night, what efforts would you make to support my cause about the rising threat of evil in this city? 

Q2. Please come up with a convincing game-plan for having me come shopping with you, keeping in mind my retail oriented attention span is about twelve minutes, and I am prone to wandering after flashing lights and shiny things. 

Q3. Please argue why you are (do) or are not (do not): 'Down to Earth', 'Have a sense of humor' and 'Laid back'. Bonus if you can include evidence to confirm that you truly do avoid 'head games.' 

Please submit answers via the email link provided. Please also keep a of this test and your answers to submit to future suitors for reference. Remember to ensure your name, number and bra size are clearly written at the top of your paper, and don't forget to attach a photo (3/4 length or full).

title: Daddy needs his little Little - Dd/lg ddlg honest and forever
text:
I've read the lines here. I've had the marginal encounters and relationships. While it is possible for a Little Girl (hereafter: lg) to find a Daddy on CL. I wonder. I know I am a good Daddy. I know that I care for my little above all else. I also know that you are about as likely to meet a good Daddy, whatever your definition, here as at a club, or anywhere else online.

What I also know is that there are many 'Daddys', here as anywhere else who suffer from a lack of maturity and a decided misunderstanding about the role of a true, honest Daddy. Asking a woman, who wants to feel like a girl, to call you 'daddy' during sex does not make you a Daddy. Wanting not only power, but control, does not make you a Daddy.

Taking a woman in your hand as a true and forthright Daddy is like being asked to hold the Hope Diamond. It isn't a trifle. You are not picking something out of the free box at a yard sale.

A Daddy, a real Daddy to a lg, little, kitten or even a babydoll is holding in his hands a star. Not a famous star, but a bright star like you see in the night sky on a fantastic summer evening when the wind is coming from the South and the big dipper is out.

When a woman (I'm straight, but if you need to do substitutions feel free, I'm writing in my voice, but my voice is only mine [insert rainbow]). Sorry, where were we while I apologized to many gay wing men? Oh yea... When a woman, who IS A PERSON has a personality quirk that makes her DESIRE certain behaviors or treatments, the assumption of certain roles in your relationship, the exploration of certain boundaries, the abdication of some parts of her own personal responsibility and her heart. Truly, deeply her heart; if you take that lightly, you're a dick.

I don't mean you're like a pick up drunk chicks at a bar dick. I mean you're a stepping on your own soul kind of dick, or stepping on your dick kind of soul. -- Now, not to be judgmental, but seriously, this is a serious thing. If all you want is to have a chick call you Daddy, fine. That is a legit deal.

But...

Holding someones heart and soul in your hands is a completely, utterly, different thing.

AND - I'm not even going to start with the impact on them (while it is the most important part). I'm going to start on what it will mean for you.

High Maintenance. Massive. Epic. If you're some college kid or old dude who thinks DD/lg ddlg or however you abbreviate it is a way to get either laid or a sub girlfriend let me tell you, that's like driving from New York to LA via Tokyo. Your lg will need more from you than you may imagine. 

Think about a suburban trophy wife. She's kind of thought of as the epitome of high maintenance. While she is not my personal taste, I get it. She's her own kind of beautiful. She's art. But, she does have the reputation of being high maintenance. However, you can often define her maintenance in dollar terms. She knows it! She doesn't work. She and her Mister have an arrangement.

A little / lg is different. She is generally much less materialistic (not making a judgement) but she needs TIME. Enormous, huge, space warping amounts of time. She didn't hand you responsibility for her checkbook, she handed you her heart and soul.

If you think all day about the great sex with her you want to have, but when you see your lg after work you can tell she had a shitty day and your needs aren't immediately erased, you don't deserve her. If you can't become zen with her mood shifts, if you aren't willing to undertake the role she has given you as mentor, friend, companion, confidant of the highest level, sometimes master, sometimes counselor, sometimes just a pair of arms and always a guardian; just go buy any broke chick on the East Side two margaritas and ask her to call you daddy. It's OK!

I have seen my latest little fly away. She went to a better long term thing for herself and I can only wish her the best. 

My new lg is out there. I can feel her and she can feel me. She's a shorty, like under 5'3''. She's a little thick or a little thin. She likes her body, but she wants someone else to like it too. She might be blonde or brunette, redhead or bleached. She might have ink, or she might be a blank. She might be bored in the city or bored in the suburbs. She might want to wear a collar, or she might want to wear kitten ears. I might be her first Daddy, I might be her last Daddy or I might just be her next Daddy. When we find each other, or find each other again, that warm wind will cross our faces from the South and my Little will know her Daddy loves her. Because I, like other good Daddies, will give her time.

text:
Okay - I know there are about a billion ads on craigslist seeking someone to help act out their very particular sexual fantasies. The problem with so many of them is that they're not looking for anything more than the act. They wrongly presume that if they can just fuck somebody, their needs will be taken care of. And, I suppose, they will be for a little while. But they'll never reach a deeper level of satisfaction. That's what I'm pursuing.

So what am I talking about, exactly? I'm talking about an extremely passionate and intense (by which I do not mean painful) version of the dom/sub relationship. The mentor relationship. The one where control and submission plays a role. 

Let me clear up for you what that means if the only frame of reference you have for this sort of thing is 50 Shades of Grey. 

Firstly, forget 50 Shades. What we're dealing with there is a sociopath, and the misguided and terribly unhealthy fantasy some women have of getting with a sociopath. Yes - some people actually want that. Some people want to be abused. Some people wouldn't mind a meth addiction. But that's not what we're looking for here. 

Secondly, the dom/sub relationship is only superficially a dom/sub relationship. What I mean is - the actions appear to an untrained eye that the dom is controlling the sub, and that the whole purpose of the sub is to be used and controlled by the dom. What the untrained eye is missing is the deep sense of respect that exists between the healthy couple who participate in this form of intense sexual interchange. 

Thirdly - I am not posting this ad (as you probably have inferred by now) because I have some deep, unconscious, self-serving need to own women. I am also not posting because I am a sexual adolescent who still speaks to his bros about women as if they were trophies to be collected. I'm posting because I'm looking for a woman who either deeply understands what the healthy dom/sub relationship is really about OR a woman who has these cravings, doesn't understand them, and really wants to learn.

I'm tall. I'm fit. I'm attractive. I'm educated. And I want to get to know you. This is not for a one-night thing. The various role-play activities we might engage in require a much deeper sense of connection than you could establish in a single night (at least much deeper than the vast majority of people could establish). 

Importantly, I'm not looking for a woman who wants to submit to me outside of the bedroom. God no. I love opinionated, intelligent women with style. I want a woman who respects herself, who knows what she wants (or is interested in learning), and who has a deep sense of playfulness and curiosity. 

This has been a long ad (at least relative to the other craigslist ads). If you've made it this far, odds are you should contact me. Let's be honest, 99% of people probably zoned out and clicked the back button as soon as they opened it and saw it contained multiple paragraphs.

title: I am a dummy...
text:
I am a dummy. And I am a mess. When we just met I knew exactly what was going to happen. You are my "type". The type that doesn't mesh well with my personality and lifestyle, yet the only "type" that I enjoy spending time with without getting bored. I went for it, hoping for the best. I knew we'd fall in love madly. I didn't anticipate things moving that quickly. We were both stubbornly and happily single for several years before, didn't want to be in any kind of a relationship, every topic we discussed was a reassurance that we just might pull it off. 

It happened. We did fall in love madly, stayed on the phone through just about every night, introduced each other to our respective child, moved in together, merged our families, every dream came true for both of us.

Then the honeymoon phase ended. We did a great job pushing and pulling and hurting each other (and, I am sure, our kids as well). All of a sudden, regardless of what I did (or didn't do) I was no longer a part of your life. As if I never existed. We lived in the same house, slept in the same bed, ate dinner at the same table and while we were physically in each other's company, you've moved on. 

You are gone. You have a new place, a new start, a new phase in your life. You feel this is what you need to do next. I keep walking around the empty house, checking all the nooks and crannies, hoping to find something (a note? some other sign?), looking out the window hoping to see your car where it was always parked, checking my phone every two seconds for something. Anything, anything at all from you. There is nothing. Just the memories in each and every inch of this empty house where we shared so many things together. 

I am venting. I refuse to talk to any of my friends or family about what happened. They tell me I need to move on. I am sure I will. Time does magic after all. But today, in this very moment, I am not yet ready to... Over the last few months, I felt physically and emotionally abandoned and neglected. I begged for any consideration (maybe that's my issue; men aren't supposed to be emotional after all), hit my head against the wall so many times, yet was always willing to pick up and try again. Do something different. Get that spark and the butterflies in our stomachs again. Understand and meet each other's needs after the honeymoon phase. Work on our relationship, commit to it long term, do whatever it takes. 

We've done a great job hurting each other. I am sorry for my contribution to that. I never wanted to hurt you. Turns out relationships require work, commitment, and communication if they are to be long term; care for each other and each other's needs, not just continued push and pull, saying things one wants to say with no regard as to how it may affect the other person. Everything is possible. We have (had?) something amazing. I am not a quitter but it takes two to tango. 

There is so much more I want to say, but I am done ranting. I am sorry..........

And you are now reading this to determine what exactly I mean by "freak". That word has a lot of different meanings to different people. But in all cases, it's used to marginalize people that have a slightly different view of whats fun from the majority of the population. I don't think I need to define it more than that.

The thing is, that we all want to have good relationships, and we want for our partners to share in the fun that we have. We also want them to share the fun that they like with us. There is more of course... we want them to make the attempt to communicate well, and we want them to support our life decisions, and we want for them, occassionally to push our boundaries, to get us to explore new and different things. That pushing of boundaries? Anyone that does that over time will find that they probably call themselves a bit of a freak.

title: Searching for someone I can learn not to hate
text:
First: Fuck Amazon.

Second: The title says it all, doesn't it?

Third: I'm a misanthrope. We're a dumb species which fucks up everything we can reach. I scream up into the sky,:"Help me, I'm stuck in a primate made of rotting meat and I need an exit!"

No one answers.

Which is fine because I like being left alone, but sometimes I feel lonely and want to connect. I have nothing special to say, but sometimes I want to commiserate with someone over Bowie's last album or the latest Always Sunny episode, or why we need so much specialized clothing for running when, aside from fucking, it seems like the thing we're most physically built to do. Sometimes, perhaps even often, I want someone to protect from this shit hole of a world. (Is shit hole two words or one? I never know.)

Things I like: Writing, reading, mud runs, shooting pool, meditating, cooking, and smoking that dank weed. Yeah, you heard me, Dead Nancy Reagan. I heard about your death while I was legally high on weed in 2016. Come at me. That's right. Come at me Zombie Nancy Reagan. DO IT! You think we aren't prepared for a zombie attack? We dumbshits are more prepared for a zombie attack than any other possible calamity on Earth. Like, if a zombie outbreak happened humanity would stop that shit within a single news cycle. Poverty, Zeka virus, Drumpf? Not so much.

I also like bowling, but I haven't gone lately.

Things I like to observe: movies, stand-up, people fighting (real or fake), space stuff, you in that sexy outfit.

What I like in humans: Nothing.

What I kinda like in humans: Sense of humor. Gleeful pessimism. Reckless abandon. Loyalty. Truth. Love. Hate. Passion.

What I dislike in humans: Ego. Self-righteousness. Self-seriousness. Ambition. Greed. Blind optimism. Caution.

What I really like in humans: Knowing none of this matters. Beautiful nihilism. Sense of humor.

Fourth: I probably don't want to meet you. Maybe I will. Probably not. But we can be text buddies! I usually either connect with people immediately or never. I doubt we will connect. Or that anyone will answer this. But maybe! (gleeful pessimism.) But, seriously, probably not.

Fifth: I'm a night man, not a day man. I work graveyard. Some people may call me a Batman sort of figure. I don't know who those people would be, but I'm sure they're out there. Similar schedules would be nice.

Anyhow, boo, I've worked on this ad for a least 10 minutes so it's about time to wrap this up. I feel I totally did not express myself the way I wanted, but we're all little failures, so in that way this craigslist ad is perfect.

title: Seeking cute kinkster for potential LTR

I've dated women before who I've gotten along great with outside of the bedroom, but didn't share the same interests or kinks in the bedroom and while the sex was good, it wasn't all fireworks and unicorns farting rainbows. I've also dated women who I've had almost everything in common with sexually and it was mind-blowing and fun, but I've never found anyone who could be my best friend outside of the bedroom. This is my attempt at finding a woman who can fill both of those roles in my life, and I could fill those roles in hers. So here's hoping that putting both sides of my life out there might yield someone who could complete the puzzle that is me.

I'm a 30 year old guy, considered attractive by most, tall with a lean/fit build, intelligent, playful and serious in equal parts (okay, maybe sometimes a little more the former than the latter), clean, sane, DDF (420 exception), atheist/agnostic, liberal. I'm honest, loyal, kind and logical. I'm pretty laid back and go with the flow most of the time. I enjoy hanging out with friends, going out and grabbing a beer or seeing a movie or snuggling up at home and seeing what Netflix has to offer. I work full-time Monday-Friday, have my own car, have my shit together, no kids or baggage.

I'm looking for a girl who is fun to hang out with, who enjoys stimulating conversation and telling jokes and generally having fun and isn't intimidated by moments of silence. Someone who is affectionate and kind, but can also flick someone shit and and take it as well as dish it out. Someone to go to the gym with, go out and get dinner or cook dinner with, cuddle up and watch TV or read with. But also someone who is independent and not codependent.

And now for what you've all been waiting for. The nitty gritty sexual proclivities. I tend to enjoy being dominant in the bedroom, and I love for things to get a little naughty. A few things that I'm into: rough sex, spanking (giving), hair-pulling, ass-play and anal sex (giving), deepthroating/facefucking (giving), rimming (giving), talking dirty, choking, and a number of other things that get me off, none of it being TOO extreme. I'm not into bondage and ropes or leaving marks, but I will pin your wrists above your head and fuck you until you cum over and over and over until you're begging for me to stop. And I'm not looking for somebody who will tolerate doing these things in bed to make me happy, I'm looking for somebody who WANTS to do these things and enjoys them because they make both of us happy. I'm always up for exploration and experimentation as well. I like to consider myself very open-minded and non-judgmental. And I understand that sex isn't always a full-on kinkfest and there's always a time and place for sensual lovemaking (holy shit, that sounds so fucking corny), but I imagine the sex falling somewhere between the two extremes most of the time, but obviously fun all of the time. And if you're a babygirl looking for a daddy to make happy, I could totally be into that, too.

I don't expect, or want for that matter, the D/s dynamic to extend outside of the bedroom unless previously discussed. Out in the real world, I want an equal. A partner. Someone to totally trust, provide support without judgement, grow together and generally have an awesome fucking time together.

I'm not looking for someone to come over and fuck me right away. Let's go out, let's spend some time together. Let's grab a drink or dinner or coffee. Get to know each other. We'll both have an idea and be into what might happen in the bedroom, so let's see how we do outside of the bedroom first. Let's make each other laugh and think. You know, grow some feelings for each other. I know, I know. 'EWWW, feelings, gross!' Well, I want to catch some feelings for someone.

If you're into giving this a shot, send me a message with a picture and a little bit about yourself. Like I said before, I'm nice to look at and I'll send a picture in my reply. If I don't reply, I apologize beforehand. It just means I don't think we would be a good fit. Maybe we can hit it off and see if we can't get something good going.

title: Let Time Go Lightly ................
text:
So much of the day's activities are hurried, rushed in such a manner as to become insignificant. Whatever happened to stop and smell the roses? Especially when it comes to finding that significant other.

The risk of taking the chance conversations. Of meeting, and by chance, finding commonality and perhaps even attraction. Sowing the seed of dating and companionship. Finding that time can go lightly in anticipation of the next togetherness. Time measured by the heart, not by some light speed instant gratification.

James Taylor sang of the secret of life "is enjoying the passage of time". If you agree, why use your time endlessly planning hopes of what could be while avoiding what is present? Endless optimism and dreams are wondrous to be sure; they are also more valuable through certainty. 

Now I am not going to offer up the "normal" listings of likes/dislikes, neither shortcomings nor assets. Shouldn't that part of discovery be the path of the journey? I will only say this, I am clean (in every sense of what that word entails), honest, ethical, secure. Like anyone, have my limits of tolerance.

Not especially strict on "limits" -- be helpful if you are reasonably in shape, twixt forties and sixty, not otherwise engaged in a relationship, not some superficial nit-wit. That's all folks, keep it meaningful, keep it uncomplicated, and I am not your therapist so get drama relief elsewhere. 

Happy Spring!

title: How's this for a first date?
text:
It is early morning as you drive to the Airport, you see the sun rising in the east. You notice as you drive to the airport the crystal blue skies. 



You park your car and walk through the hanger. Outside you see the Falcon jet waiting, door open and steps down. The pilot walks over to great you and helps with your bag. You climb aboard the waiting jet. 



You turn to the right and pass the galley. The aircraft is larger than you pictured it. You notice seating for 8. All you really care about is seating for 2. 



Your date boards the aircraft; he is tall 6', 175 lbs, blue eyes, athletic build, great smile, he gives you a firm hug and a kiss. You sit down in the plush leather chairs and notice the flowers on the table in front of you. In it is a card that reads. "Welcome aboard, this is the beginning of something new" 



It is 6.30, early yet perfect to take off to destination unknown. 



You have talked to him on the phone, met for drinks and emailed over a period of time and feel you have really gotten to know him, you feel comfortable with him and are ready for this new, fun and exciting adventure. 



The pilot gives you a quick rundown on the safety features shuts the door and heads to the flight deck. You hear the 3 engines start and you slowly start to head out towards the runway. 



You Taxi to the North and stop just short of the runway, it is a wonderful day for flying. You watch as other planes land and you see the small Cessna in front of you head down the run way to take off. 



The Plane slowly makes a turn to the active runway pointing south. 



You hear the engines getting louder and you slowly start to roll you feel the force of this wonderful aircraft take you down the runway. It seems like only a minute and you are airborne! 



The climb-out is smooth, the sun is shining and the clouds look like candy as you climb out. You notice that the aircraft is turning to the East. Once again you ask yourself where I am going. 



The conversation is great. You both are comfortable talking about anything and everything from kids to family to dreams. You laugh and enjoy each others company. 



As the plane reaches cruise the screens around the aircraft light up to show where you are and where the closest towns are, it lets you know speed but fails to give you a location of where you will wind up. 



You have a light breakfast and a toast of Champaign to start the day. 



You wonder where we are going. Did I pack the right clothes.... 



In the end it does not matter, you know in your heart you have finally found him. The ride on the plane is like the ride of life, a few bumps along the way.



It does not matter how many bumps there are as long as the person sitting next to you is holding your hand.

title: Honest
text:
I believe being honest with yourself and being honest with each other is the most important cornerstone of any adult relationship. Unfortunately lately I haven't been as honest with myself as I should have been. I am changing that. So, let me begin by saying that I am currently unhappily married.

I am sure that is a deal breaker for most women and I can understand that. Why someone would be turned off by that; nobody wants to be called ugly names or feel like they are "wrecking" something. You are not wrecking anything. Currently is the correct adjective to describe my present situation. 

(Maybe you are married too, feel the same way, and that is a selling point for you. If so, go you!)

I am looking for a genuine connection with someone. Hopefully you looking for the same.

Please know what you want out of life. What do you want out of life? Where you see yourself in ten minutes from now? Please know what you want from this. Whatever this is. Whatever we define it to be.

I have gone through a very long time in my life being unhappy. I am changing that also. 

I am ready to be happy again with someone I can make happy. Someone that wants me to make them happy. Make them laugh. Make them dinner. Make them whatever they want me to make them.

Please send a picture if you are interested. Although, I would probably reply to you if you don't. I wouldn't want a picture stop me from something truly wonderful.

Thank you for reading my post.

title: The true, complete, freedom of a Christian, (Total Submission
text:
The true, complete, freedom of a Christian, (Total Submission) - 56 (Western Washington)

True freedom is only possible when you are in a state of complete, and total submission. Most people feel that to be in complete submission to anyone, or thing, you will be a slave to the object of your submission; This is actually the case. Now the question is not "Do you want to live as a slave, or not?" for we are all slaves to something. The question is do you even realize what you are a slave to. I mean we (people that is) do not own things, they own us. It is a common belief that to be really free you must be able to decide for your self what you will do, where you will go, when you will go there, and what you will do when you are there. However in that situation you are merely slave to your own desires, aspirations, and the responsibility, good or bad, for the results thereof.
True freedom is freedom from all responsibility. Both the responsibility to choose the right, or the best thing to do, Also the guilt for not doing the best, or right thing. This "Freedom" is only possible when in a sate of total submission to God. When you can freely confess to God that you are utterly sinful, and unclean. That you sin against Him constantly in thought, word, and deed. Both by the things you do, and also those you do not do; The things you say, and those you leave unsaid. Basically if you do it, it is wrong. If you do it, and it is not wrong; It was not actually being done by you. It was actually done wholly, and completely by God both in, and though you. To him be all credit, praise, and glory!

At the same time you should know, via the gift of faith, (Ephesians 2:8 & 9) that God has not only perfectly forgiven you for every wrong thing you may ever do (Perfectly Forgiven=As if it never happened) but will also make everything that happens because of all the wrong things done all work together for the good of those that love Him. To those that are among the called according to His good purposes (Romans 8:28).

Then you can be completely free from any guilt, stress, or worry. You can be completely free to "Let Go, and Let God" (Love God, Trust God, and do as you please.) For it is God that is at work in, you to both will, and to do according to His good pleasure (Philipians 2:13)

If you are moved to flag this post God's will is being done, and I shall thank God for it

text:

title: We didn't meet on Craig's List!
text:
We can contrive an elaborate story how we met. We can say we met at the Seattle Art Museum. How I was admiring the elegant clean lines of an African wood carving when I was distracted by the even more impressive lines of your slender figure in a little black dress. And how we had drinks across the street at the Four Seasons before moving onto the Pike Street Market for dinner and more drinks.

Or we can say we met on the slopes when we shared a double chairlift and then spent the rest of the day together discovering powder stashes before hitting the lodge and an apres ski hot tub. 

Or we can say we met at Linda's, trying to distract ourselves from V-Day. We looked blearily across the bar through half full whiskey glasses and it was love, or lust, at first sight. Several boilermakers later we stumbled out together into a grey cold night and uber'd home. 

Or we can say we met say we at the Cinerama. Pathetically going to the movies alone, our reserved seats were fatefully right next to each other. We watched previews argued about whether regular or chocolate popcorn was better. We drank beer and wine with our popcorn and struggled to keep our hands to ourselves while we watched Star Wars. After the movie we crawled through the pubs of Belltown together. 

So if you want to meet, tell me which way you'd like to say we met, how old you are and include photo. And remember, we didn't meet on Craig's List.
