title: MARRIED - LOOKING FOR SOMEONE IN THEIR 40's or 50's
text:
I'm a 31 year old, deep voiced, clean-shaven, in shape, well dressed white collar professional. I don't smoke, I'm not into pot, and to be honest actually very rarely even drink. I'm married, no kids, and while I have my reasons, I'm not going to go into why I'm looking to connect with someone outside of marriage at this time. Suffice it to say, I've made this choice and am okay with it. If you're still interested, read on.

I'm not interested in any sort of one or two night stands and once I find someone, I'm not looking to keep things "open". I don't want to (nor do I have the time to anyways) have anything going with more then just you. I'm not interested in sex the first time we meet either. I'll be honest and just say I truly do not want to meet you somewhere and just jump into bed, or the back seat of my car, or behind the bushes, or wherever the hell else people fornicate these days 30 seconds after the first bloody email. I think it's disrespectful for one to have that sort of experience with someone and then just shake hands and say peace out plus it's sort of like opening Christmas presents in late November - it doesn't leave much to look forward to. I'd much rather feel like I know the person a little bit first and have a bit of a back story and personality to enjoy as well. Also, I'm sure you've almost gone blind from all the dick-pics guys so willingly flood your email with anyways.

It doesn't matter if you are in a relationship currently or not, but if you are just know that I'm not interested in messing up my marriage or anyone else's. What I AM looking for is someone that is available during the day Mondays through Fridays, who's over 40, ideally is close to or in Seattle proper, and is interested in truly having a secret affair together. I like the idea of someone new and all that comes with it. I miss that "first date" kind of feeling and being able to learn all about someone new; their interests, personality, a new perfume, the first kiss. I want to have someone that I can talk to discreetly online from time to time and meet up every once in a while - a few times a week, once every month or two, whatever ends up working out best. But I like having something exciting to look forward to and being able to share that secret with someone. 

So why the age difference? I've dated women in the past that were older than me and while there were some of the better relationships I've had, I also just honestly am more attracted to them. Some men like blondes, some like lots of tattoos - I've always been attracted to older women. 

All that said, I love to make people laugh and have a very light-hearted personality. I'm not into the bar scene, video games, Kanye, or people who don't like coffee. :) I think most of the girls out there are probably a little tired of all the little boys and would be interested to know there's a few cowboys left that can break a few rules, have some fun, but as contradictory as it may sound, do so with some class. 

I'm a pretty open book and in the end I just want to find someone cute, have a few laughs, and see where it goes. If you're interested, you know what to do. If you're trying to send me to an outside link, if you're a guy, or if you are in high school - keep movin'.

Cheers

title: The truth
text:
Thank you for taking some time to read this. I honestly don't expect it to be up long someone will get offended and flag this I'm sure. If I touch a nerve for you on this I am sorry but like the title says I am going to tell the truth.

So starters me I am mid 30s I have a job, I work hard in my own way. I enjoy Netflix, Play station, working out, playing sports, comics/ super hero stuff, and relaxing. I am not in the best shape I have ever been in but I am working on that. I have faults far to many to list here. I'm not a super model or a regular one (why are the super?) but lets face it neither are you, if you are why are you looking on CL for a date. I have self esteem issues not that I want to kill myself but I have bad days where I know I use to be better than I am now. I know I will never wear skinny jeans, I will also probably never hunt. I do like good times cheap wine and old rock and roll. 

Ladies if you have read this far buckle up for some truths for you. I have dated all types of women, different races, body size, and beauty levels. So when I say this I don't mean to be rude, but if you are ugly own it be up front if you are big so what tell a guy up front. Now here's a hard one most guys like kids they don't really scare us away but there are very few guys who will marry you when you already have 4-5 on your own. 

I'm not going to waist time saying what I am looking for. If you read this smiled a bit shook your head and maybe agreed and you want to talk hit me up if not and you are passed off, darling that's something you should think about on your own. 

Love you all and I do mean that I think everyone out there can be great in there own way. Just try not to take things so serious and don't be a Dick.

title: . . . . . . . . The Curse Of The 30's! . . . . . . . .
text:
The damn curse of the 30's is upon me. Here is what the curse entails:

As soon as I crossed the cursed # 30, things started changing, overnight! These are some of the things that have changed in my life:

1. Gave up my comics for The New York Times

2. Started preferring Japanese cars over American cars because of their reliability (never thought a day would come when I would take car advice from Consumer Reports instead of Hip Hop videos!)

3. Started looking in the mirror and wondering what I would look like if I went bald someday (I resolve never to resort to any as-seen-on-tv product or a comb over)

4. Started shopping at The Gap (Because it is better lit and the music isn't as loud compared to the store I used to previously shop at!)

5. Got a Costco membership (not sure though what I am going to do with the 12 scissors, 30 tooth pastes, 10 gallons of laundry detergent, 300 pilot pens, and 6 dozen light bulbs that I have purchased!)

6. Started keeping a bottle of hand sanitizer at my desk (never thought becoming a germaphobe will be one of the many wonder of being 30)

7. Started reading reviews of mattresses (they seem to be more high tech these days than my cell phone from 5 years ago!)

8. Became aware of the existence of 401K (I used to think 401K was an insanely long marathon. Enlightenment came when I realized I had enough money to retire comfortably for the rest of my life...if I were to die the following Wednesday!)

9. Started reading labels on the back of food items (I have solved the greatest mystery of my 20's - I now know why my ice cream doesn't melt - zantham gum isn't what I thought it was)

title: Must Love SEX, A LOT!
text:
So, before you go a flagging, since I assume that a lot of you are reading this to decide if it's spam or miscategorized... It's not.

Here is the deal... In a relationship, it's important that the two partners have roughly the same tendancies towards sex. If the two are out of synch... one wants it more, the other wants it less... one of 2 or 3 things will happen...

One... The partner that wants sex more will vocalize that desire, and if they get it, they may feel like they are forcing sex on thier partner, and the partner, may feel like having sex is necessary to keep that partner. There will be resentment. A BAD thing for relationships.

Two: The partner that wants sex less will NOT grant sex to the partner that wants it more. There will be resentment... Not a good thing for relationships...

Three... The two can come to some accommodation around sex and try to meet in the middle... A harried not quite balanced situation that often doesn't work well.

Four: The partners can agree that they will have ALL the sex that the partner that wants it less wants... and then the partner that wants it more is free to find the "more " elsewhere. This is ok if you can handle openness in relationships, and there is no jealousy, and communication is there.


So, to me... I've ALWAYS been the partner that wants MORE sex. I've been told I'm a freak. I've been denied sex, I've been told that I'm pressuring for sex... I don't really want an out of balance situation anymore... It's just NO fun.

The bottom line is that if you feel sex is a relationship "Chore" go back now. I do NOT want to talk to you. If you feel sex once a month is enough then leave now. If you have had a child, and now sex is obviously ONLY for making babies, and you don't need anymore now... We are NOT a good match.

So, if you are a woman that wakes up horny, is always grabbing your man, and getting things going, then we should talk... If you don't need a huge deal set of excuses to get in the mood, we should talk (it's not that I don't like foreplay, I love it, but I don't want to spend 5 hours romancing someone when if we are both "there" it's just obvious what we ought to be doing...) If you have been told by men that you are a nympho as a way to control your sexual appetite, well, you won't hear that from me, and we should talk... If you've wanted to explore fantasies around sex (maybe in the center of Stonehenge on the night of a full moon? or... the front of a ferryboat on a moonlit night, or in a glass elevator... or with multiple men serving your wanton desires... or... what's YOUR fantasy? The bottom line here is that I'm a decent human being looking for something meaningful, but this issue of sexuality seems to get in the way.

Oh yeah, it wouldn't hurt if you were thinner blonder richer, but those are in no way requirements (well, except for NOT being really FAT)... I'm pretty openminded.

title: to be truly unique is to be truly alone
text:
here's to hoping that i'm not so unique. i am attractive, very intelligent, intense, and passionate. i have dug myself out from the depths of hell several times, fought to the top and had the floor drop out from under me. i have always been the one my friends turn to when they need a shoulder to lean on or cry on but when i need a shoulder no one can be found. i'm tired. i have given 100% to everything my whole life and for once i just want someone to give something back. all i have left to give is myself but i will give you the world if you just give me a chance. 

attraction is very important, unless you want an asexual friendship, which i'm open to but that isn't what i'm after here. i don't care what your race or nationality is, i'm a man we don't see color, we see shape. as far shape goes, i am only interested in girls that are a healthy weight hourglass figure. 
age wise i need a girl between 21 and 38. NO KIDS i have done the stepdad thing still love those kids but i can not do that again, will not. sorry but for once i need to be a priority instead of a tool to be used and discarded. i don't care if you have a shit job a great job or no job at all. if you have a job cool that makes things easier, but all that really matters to me is if you enjoy your job or not. i have a car and a roof and food and smokes, i don't need your money, i'm tired, not lazy. i would really appreciate a woman who is very intelligent, and understanding as i am, someone to challenge and inspire me. 
i loathe pop music, hate rap with a passion. jazz, country and "christian/praise music is mindnumbingly boring to me. listening to any of those for long periods of time makes want to bash my head into a wall till i fall into a coma, so if any of those are your predominant music choice, we won't work at all. now i know i am really getting into the unicorn territory here, but i'm mythical in my own way and i'm just trying to save my species here. 
i listen to mostly heavy metal, industrial, hard rock, and classic rock. my favorite bands are iced earth, dope, bls, megadeath, volbeat, and nin. i love cars, with a passion, i got my first car (67 f100 pickup) at 8 years old rebuilt it completely by age 12 and have been driving and racing and building cars since then. i prefer cars that are older than me, regardless of brand and appreciate all modified cars as mobile art and self expression of the driver, though the only thing a honda expresses is how much of a douche waffle the owner is, they are an easy pay check if they ever shut up nut up and line up. 
well if i haven't offended or scared you away by now and you miraculously fit the bill shoot me a message and tell me about yourself and something you have a deep passion for. include a good face and body picture, don't be deceptive and don't waste my time with a hundred one sentence emails or vague descriptions. if you can't be upfront and honest with me than i won't want you anyways. i don't play games, or semantics or use any kind of deception or manipulation. i won't deal with any of that crap, i will always be straight forward and honest, i'm not subtle or passive. even if i catch your hints i will ignore them, i don't play that, we're adults say what you mean, mean what you say.

title: A bit out of the norm
text:
Seeking a full relationship, not casual, not FWB. Don't want to jump into sex right away, that can be a mistake, but do want casual cuddling ASAP if we are feeling the love as my body and soul thirst for the kindness and intimacy of just holding and kissing each other.

I am a bit out of the norm. Highly intelligent, funny as hell, great cook, great career. However I suffered a trauma a couple of years ago and am just about fully recovered. The fallout of this is: While I was always a kind person, I am now a particularly sensitive person, in both directions. I am very empathetic, but I also bruise easily emotionally, so I'll need you to be kind. However that is the type of person I want to be with anyway, so that should not be a big deal. I used to be super fit but have gained about 20 lbs, but I'm starting to get my mojo back there, I bike 20 miles daily when it isn't raining, however the tummy fat is proving to be a bit stubborn, I'm 5'8" 180lbs when I should be closer to 160. My hair turned white from the trauma, I used to look much younger than my years, now I get offered senior discount (I don't qualify), but my body is still young in every other way. I am set financially and have location flexibility. My professional career is behind me, when I do have excess time, I use it for volunteer work to help other folks. If things get that far, I am mildly kinky, actually less so than I thought before coming to the big city, I'm probably a 2 on the Seattle scale. I'm open to explorations, but can't do dark scenarios where I am violent or even mean, although perhaps mildly manipulative in a pervy kind of way might be a possibility. All of my kinky fantasies are loving and "consensual", at least as much as taboo roleplay scenarios can be considered "consensual". Did I say that out loud?

I don't give a toss about race, age, height, accent, thigh gap, or weight as long as you are not extremely obese. I have a wide range of attraction, a good attitude and general cuteness of personality go a long way with me. Kids are not a deal breaker, in fact I may enjoy them a great deal if they like to giggle, I like making kids giggle, but less so if your 12 year old already smokes, has tattoos, is throwing gang signs, and showing general signs of poor parentage. In the other direction, I can help them with their algebra, calculus, physics, and American literature, as long as you are not Tiger Mom and have some perspective.

Pluses (about you): General hilarity and wit, smiley people, urge to give and get tummy rubs, cooking skills but will settle for you just enjoying good food as I know how to make it, kink as long as you don't want me to hurt you, comfortable shoes, ability to be silly especially around kids and animals, affinity for crafted stuff like vintage wools and waxed cotton, liking to make stuff, addiction to Better Call Saul.

Nos (No's? What the plural of no? *google* Noes. Really?): Your being married or in a committed relationship (unless you just need that lesbian thing on the side, because that might be hot), ANY STDs, drugs (narcotics) other than 420 and MMDA (I don't use either but have encountered those who have and it's fine, I'll have to tell you about the MMDA one, that's a funny story), cigarettes, seriously unhealthy lifestyles with no desire to change (I don't want you to die young from heart stoppage or blood sugar of 1000), anger and bitchiness issues, bigotry of any kind, gambling issues, living your life guided by religious doctrine, silver spoon syndrome, watching professional wrestling or cage fights, lack of general hygiene, a relationship dependent on "nightlife". Possibly tattoos depending on how silly it looks.

I'm currently in downtown Seattle but willing to travel for the right girl. You can send a pic if you like, but I do not need one for a reply, as I do not send out pics of me, there are too many scammers collecting pics. Short replies will get no response, tell me about you, words mean more than pics. Say "yes I read that" at the top of the email body so I know you have read the ad.

title: Seeking an Enigma
text:
I like that word Enigma - though it implies complexity and something difficult to understand. Maybe that's me in a way - I often feel I'm on a slightly different wavelength to others but now and then I find someone equally tilted and feel a strong connection.

I'm not weird in any alarming way (I don't think!) but I am a mix of necessary convention with singularly different qualities. I continue to try to find my path through this existence - hoping it really isn't just about material acquisition. I do enjoy a comfortable life - steady well-paid job, and everything I need to sustain me - though there is a big gap somewhere. I am a loner who is lonely.

Having gone through two marriages (not all bad but ultimately not enough) and several wonderful relationships. The times that I have been most happy have been with someone who was prepared to see into my soul - which I usually tend to bare quite easily. I love being able to just be myself and to be with someone who can share their true self too. Whether it is sharing absurd thoughts without fear of being laughed at, or debating the meaning of life as we both see it - or simply enjoying the simple things in life together knowing that they are more rewarding for the sharing.

I am 57, and have been 'single' for many years though have had plenty of dates that never seem to lead anywhere fruitful. Perhaps I am too set in my ways having enjoyed my single life - though I am always ready for something or someone to come along which will turn my life upside down. I don't fear change, just am wary of disappointment. Perhaps I am really seeking a kindred spirit with the intention of being friends first - but friends with possibilities.

If you are curious about more personal details (height, weight, facial hair etc.) then we probably won't be a good match. That's not to say that all those things are unimportant - but it's the inner workings that make the connections that last - especially at our age. I have enjoyed relationships for their physical aspects for sure and still look forward to that side of life - but I'm looking for a soulmate more than a bedmate - though both would be nice.

From a lifestyle point of view - I consider myself smart (though not necessarily academically), romantic, open-minded, liberal, humanist, and warm. I rarely watch TV (and really dislike how TV these days seems to aim for the lowest common denominator audience). I do love movies - though not gratuitous violence or inane humor. I am more likely to be rewatching a favorite classic movie than the latest overhyped blockbuster. I enjoy good food though trying hard to eat healthier these days. I drink rarely - and preferably with good company. I like trips to nowhere in particular but would love to do more traveling.

I realise it is very much a long shot that anyone will even read this lengthy ad, much less find some connection to it. But if you can appreciate someone like me - and if you yourself are similarly unconventional and complex - then you may find the urge to reply. I do hope to get more than the typical one-liners with requests for a 'pic' that I have had from previous ads. I've tried even harder to be clear in who I am and what I am seeking - and I know there is someone out there who will understand. I do hope to hear from you.

Most brilliant and amazing people have trouble with relationships, and it's easy to see why. Where can they find an equal, someone whom they can respect? They usually have to settle for someone who's not anywhere close to their creative or intellectual level.

Do you struggle with this? Do you have trouble finding someone to date who can maintain your interest? Tired of having to dumb down your conversation or hold yourself back? Do you long for an outlet, someone in your life who is on your wavelength? Someone to share your hopes and dreams, someone dependable, committed, who you can trust and rely on? title: Off Grid Partner...and.....
text:
I've lived most of my life in the "sticks" and now divide my time between the wet side and the mountains of Eastern WA where I'm at 4000' elevation and 6 miles from the nearest utility pole. Tons of mule deer, wild turkey and elk. Occasional wolf, bear and cougar. Fantastic stars at night. BUT with reliable internet, satellite TV, and hot and cold running water. Nirvana for some people -- not so much for others. I'm just a tad into the survival/prep stuff but not a nut about it. Have also been looking for another residence on the Washington coast- but that's another story. 

Retired medical professional, and although I have graduate degrees from two Ivy League U's, I hide it well by generally dressing like I'm homeless and talking like a cross between a long-shoreman and a hillbilly. 

I am intelligent, funny, irreverent, loyal, and reliable to a fault. I am not particularly gregarious and enjoy peace, tranquility and homelife. I am a project guy and always have some plan I am trying to put together. I enjoy building and fixing things and problem solving. My ideas of fun are cooking, staying home, carpentry, staying home, reading, road trips, hiking, cooking, shooting, getting out on quads or snowmobiles, learning new things and doing just about anything with my hands. I have nothing against travel as long as it does not involve an airplane. 

I'm chronologically 64 years of age. 5'8". One hundred seventy five lbs., continually active, fit, financially stable. Don't smoke, drink good beer, don't do drugs, open to 420.

I'm completely non-PC, politically eclectic,and open to anything from a full time LTR to a part time R, to close friends w/ or w/o benefits, activity partners -- whatever. 

I've seen women list 25 requirements in posts looking for designer men. I think I have relatively few. 

(1) You are somewhat -- but not absurdly -- younger than myself. I've simply always fared better with women younger rather than older than I. (2) You are physically attractive and more or less HWP. Light eyes are a VERY BIG plus. (3) You are physically fit enough to spend a couple hours clambering over deadfalls on showshoes at 4000' in two feet of powder :-) (4) If you have children they are at least in their late teens. 

That's it. I don't care what religion you are, what you do for a living or if you work at all. I don't care about race, socioeconomic status, height, geographic location (with a couple exceptions) or political affiliation. It is however essential that you are SINGLE. As long as you are not a chain smoker, lips in the sand drunk 5 nights a week and/or have a severe drug habit, I don't care what you do in those regards. I am not looking for a slave, maid, housekeeper or cook. I can take care of myself and the house just fine. 

Apparently the protocol is pic-for-pic. If you respond to this ad, please be so kind as to provide a photo with your initial response. If interested I will reply in kind. Thanks.

title: Canadian Available to Marry if Trump Wins
text:
It seems with the threat of Donald J. Trump becoming the next Commander in Chief, many Americans are looking at moving to Canada as an option. Unfortunately just moving to Canada isn't as easy as one would think, as it goes the same way for a Canadian wanting to immigrate to the United States.

However marrying someone from the other persons country can help you get you a work visa a lot quicker. I'm somebody who's always wanted to live in the United States, but don't qualify unless I were vastly rich, or married an American girl.

So if you're seriously considering moving to Canada after the Donald is inaugurated on January 20th, 2017, maybe I can help make that a reality.

Don't get me wrong, I won't just marry anyone either. I am looking for true love, but would prefer that she were American, so that when Trump's reign of terror is over, we can both move back to the U.S.

Come experience Canada. It's cold in the winter, hot in the summers. All everyone talks about is hockey 24/7, which irritates me to no end; I could care less about it. We don't have In-&-Out Burger, which sucks, but we have Five Guys.

I love to cook nice candle-lit romantic dinners, take nice long romantic walks along the beach, have nice long intelligent conversations, and cuddling by the fire. I also love to get out and try new things. I am up for trying anything once if it looks fun. I love to read, workout, travel, and go to school.

Like if your partner does something special for you, you don't have to do anything for him/her that same day, but eventually in the future do something special for your partner. So if you are interested and want a great adventure, please contact me. I promise that you will not be disappointed.

Jacob

Long posts do not get read. We will talk it all over in e-mail's.

All the pictures are less then 10 Min from my door.

The Caribbean never drops below 80 degrees. Most of the time it is between 81 and 84 degrees.
The temperature never goes below 70 degrees.

title: An Affair To Remember...
text:
The story is played out in ads on Craigslist thousands of times a day. Most you'll find in the casual encounters section. 

Yes, men on this type of quest are a cent a thousand. No one bends er to pick up a penny. Perhaps I can convince you that I am the pearl that awaits you on the shore. 

I did for a moment consider posting this in "casual encounters" but after reflection realized that I don't belong in "casual encounters." What I seek is very very far from casual. I'm seeking an enduring passionate affair. 

Let's get past the preliminaries. Of course there's nothing unique about a married man seeking a woman for carnal pursuits. I claim no distinction there. 

What might be unique is that I'm seeking a very special long term monogamous relationship with a woman for reasons beyond carnal conquest. There is no thirst for me in quantity but there is a great thirst for quality. And there is consummate patience in my quest. 

I am seeking that feeling of wholeness that I once had... most importantly I desire pursuits of the mind, the heart, the soul. If I can find that then I surely know that the body will follow willingly and completely. This is a pursuit of mutual trust and a journey that I wish to be enduring. This is not a cry for a single encounter. 

She knows who she is. She may be trapped in circumstances of necessary commitment, but she is a woman invisible, unfulfilled and unappreciated. She stares in the mirror in the morning wondering what she is doing differently to not be noticed. 

She rifles through her closet baffled why the magic that some of these more enticing garments used to achieve has now dissipated. She mediates yet another loud argument at the dinner table over something so trivial but cosmically consequential and thus becomes the villain in the play. 

She falls asleep at night next to warmth and breathing, longing to be touched and cared for and desired the way she was just a blink of an eye turned into an eternity ago. 

I know her well because I am her male counterpart. Tell me your tale and you have written mine. 

I know you - I've seen you in my fantasies. You are attractive, sensual, open, adventurous, playful, and most importantly intelligent. And although you have agonized over the potential guilt the decision to read my ad has brought you, you are open to a nontraditional-nonpossessive- nondrama arrangement with an attentive, caring, and giving gentleman who will treat you with kindness, adoration, civility, and fill the emptiness in your being. 

Who are you? You are of no particular age, body style or ethnicity. You do however have a positive outlook, the desire to be wanted and needed. You live for the anticipation, the craving and adoration that you richly deserve, and you in return so sweetly give all of that willingly in return. 

Who am I? 

I'm safe, sane, attractive, very attentive and I love to please. I'm a romantic, a sentimentalist, a conversationalist, a good listener, but most importantly I can be a friend. Physically I am athletically built, brown eyes, six one and have a nice smile. I'm bright, professional, early 50's, well educated, patient, contemplative, caring, considerate, and still believe kissing is the best foreplay.

If you haven't guessed it by now, this is not an offer for just any woman. It's an offer for a very special woman. I know it will appeal to few and my search has potential to be a long and frustrating one. But I can wait, and I do hope you will find me eventually. 

If this is you, please write me. Put "invisible" in the subject line so I'll know it's not spam. 

Let's become visible again together.

title: Looking for it all!
text:
I've spent the last five years in a serious committed relationship with the mother of my two kids. About a year ago we broke up, and I'll be honest it wasn't easy on me. There were times that I thought I just lost the only woman I'd spend my entire life with. After some time, I realized that life moves on. One thing I've learned in that time is how much I want to settle down and have a family. So I'm looking for someone who isn't into playing games. That knows what they want, and that's to start a family.

About me:
I like anything from camping & hiking to cuddling up and watching a movie. I'm not interested in partying or anything like that. I'd rather spend my day running errands with the lady I'm with. I'm honest, caring, kind, trustworthy, responsible, open-minded, laid back, and loyal. Loyalty is probably the biggest trait of mine. I've never cheated on any woman I've ever dated, even if it only lasted a week. Also something that is important to know about me. Is I'm aware how a lot of men are out there. I've never physically hurt another woman in my life, and plan to keep things that way. The most important thing to know about me is, I love my kids. I'm not the typical dirt bag that doesn't step up for their children. Even though I would not want to separate my kids from their mother, there is always a part of me that wishes I could have them 24/7. So whoever I date in the future, must understand their importance to me.

What I'm looking for:
I'm looking for someone who isn't into playing games. Also someone who isn't interested in endless emails with no intention of meeting. It would be nice to find someone who is responsible and wants to start a family. The kind of woman that has no problem telling me to stop doing something stupid. In life we have struggles, so I want someone who knows that as long as we have each other we can get through anything. Someone who will be there for me, when I'm sick, sad, scared, or overwhelmed. Like a guy should, I'll stick up for you. So it's nice to have that girl that sticks up for her man. Also it's a plus if you are the type that would rather spend her evening snuggled up with her man, rather than run around town with someone else. I'm not saying we can't have friends, everyone needs friends. Just that it's a good feeling when someone would rather hang out with you than someone else.

So if you are serious about starting a family, feel free to send me a message. Who knows what you might find, until you take that chance. We might click and get married and spend the rest of our lives together. Or we might just hit it off as friends and create a good solid friendship. If interested, we can exchange pics. Please only respond if you are serious about settling down.

I'm looking for a woman who wants to build a solid relationship based on trust, communication, sympathy, patience, comprehension and compassion. Can't lie about myself, I'm not perfect. In fact I'm distant from being a good man whatever that means. If anything I'm honest and able to recognize my mistakes and faults. Don't think it is proper to write lots of things that could make me look like a dreamed man because I may not be the archetype, besides I don't like lying to people. My honesty sometimes may be perceived as blunt or tactless but it's never my intention to offend anyone. To me 
knowledge and freedom of thought are qualities I do appreciate. And the capacity to change one's mind is an attribute I definitely admire. 

Life is hard and I have my share of bad experiences. It could be right to say that life has treated me roughly as there have been times when I've wanted to give up and take the easy way out. Nevertheless, I've been able to see the good things in life and try to look things through the bright side. Perhaps that is the reason I have built a character, because I've experienced unordinary situations that have in a way hardened me. Yet, deep inside, I'm eager to find love and a partner I can share my best with. 

Recently I had a wake up call, I realized I've been chasing the fool's gold. For many years I worked hard to save up money because I wanted to be "someone" in life. With savings in the bank I made the decision to go back to school to pursue a higher education. Months later and a diminished "fortune" I came to understand that what I really needed of is love. The lack of love I've experienced made me not to even think about it. It's not easy to think about something you've never had as you don't know what is like. Therefore I kept busy thinking about other things. 

Once my twenties ended I came to understand that I've wasted years of my life wanting to be have a position in society when all I really need is a woman to love and be loved. Is it you reading this message as I open up my hearth to express something I had never dared to admit? 

I'm aware I'm shooting to the moon hoping to at least land near the stars. Don't know what I'm going to come across but whatever that is I will welcome it. 

Feel free to reply or ask me anything, as this posting is vague and doesn't really say much about my looks. All I can say about that is that if you're interested in meeting person you're going to get a surprise. Just be yourself as I will be me. Don't be afraid to step into the unknown. The unknown is what I know better and to be honest it is our fears that make it look bad but if you observer you'll notice it isn't too bad after all.

title: The long and winding road is the road less traveled
text:
Greetings single ladies of Seattle!

My name is Fred and I just landed in town from Anchorage Alaska. It was a shotgun move since I just literally just packed my stuff, bought a ticket, and off I went.

There is a song by the band Slightly Stoopid "Ever really wanted" and that sums up the reason for my dramatic move.

You see, I divorced a few years back from the only girl I ever loved. The divorce left me devastated. I swore off relationships and was single by choice for well over 4 years. I was in no rush to enter into another relationship. I certainly wasn't going to attempt another relationship until I was truly ready and capable of giving myself to another woman. 

After 4 long years of being single and lots of soul searching and self development it's time to try again.

About me: I am 6, blonde haired blue eyed devil. I am of an athletic build and keep myself rather fit. I do a lot of camping and hiking. 

I am of higher intelligence and have a well versed understanding of the world and various cultures. I am constantly traveling and experiencing life.

I am of a more alternative mind set and enjoy the more provocative adventures in life. Money means nothing to me but ethics and integrity do. I often find someone's fkaws as marks of beauty. 

I'm a natural risk taker, but I hold that to my pure Viking ancestry. I was born in Germany. Moved to Brooklyn at 8. When I turned 14 my family relocated to London where I lived until 18 when I turned down a Yale scholarship and enlisted into the US Army. 

I served for fourteen years as a Ranger. I was injured in combat and sadly medicallly forced out against my will. 

I returned to a collapsed economy and did a shotgun move to Alaska where I became a professional Brewer. I later worked on the remote North Slope as a Supervisor. Last year I jumped companies and became a project manager for shell. 

Do you remember last spring when those two off shore oil platforms where stuck in Seattle by the protesters? Well I was the manager of one of them. Shortly later the liberals banned off shore drilling and I lost my job.

I am now here in Seattle to re establish myself. I am a chef by trade but I also have a master's in Psychology and a BS in Computer Science.

I'm looking for my partner. A woman that compliments me. I am partial to Native and Asian girls but race is not an issue. Your demeanor and personality is what I'm looking at.

If you would like to meet a long term relationship minded guy who thinks outside the box please be a winner and respond. To make sure your not a robot put your favorite color in the subject line and not trying to sound vein but include some pictures of what you look like. Maybe we will click and your the next chapter in my life.

Thanks for taking the time to read my ad.

title: Jazzinator
text:
The science of love

When do you know if you fancy someone? What does love do to your brain chemicals, and is falling in love just nature's way to keep our species alive?

We call it love. It feels like love. But the most exhilarating of all human emotions is probably nature's beautiful way of keeping the human species alive and reproducing.

With an irresistible cocktail of chemicals, our brain entices us to fall in love. We believe we're choosing a partner. But we may merely be the happy victims of nature's lovely plan.


It's not what you say...
Psychologists have shown it takes between 90 seconds and 4 minutes to decide if you fancy someone.
Research has shown this has little to do with what is said, rather
55% is through body language
38% is the tone and speed of their voice
Only 7% is through what they say



The 3 stages of love
Helen Fisher of Rutgers University in the States has proposed 3 stages of love -- lust, attraction and attachment. Each stage might be driven by different hormones and chemicals.

Stage 1: Lust
This is the first stage of love and is driven by the sex hormones testosterone and oestrogen -- in both men and women.


Stage 2: Attraction
This is the amazing time when you are truly love-struck and can think of little else. Scientists think that three main neurotransmitters are involved in this stage; adrenaline, dopamine and serotonin.

Adrenaline
The initial stages of falling for someone activates your stress response, increasing your blood levels of adrenalin and cortisol. This has the charming effect that when you unexpectedly bump into your new love, you start to sweat, your heart races and your mouth goes dry.

Dopamine
Helen Fisher asked newly 'love struck' couples to have their brains examined and discovered they have high levels of the neurotransmitter dopamine. This chemical stimulates 'desire and reward' by triggering an intense rush of pleasure. It has the same effect on the brain as taking cocaine!

Fisher suggests "couples often show the signs of surging dopamine: increased energy, less need for sleep or food, focused attention and exquisite delight in smallest details of this novel relationship" .


Serotonin
And finally, serotonin. One of love's most important chemicals that may explain why when you're falling in love, your new lover keeps popping into your thoughts.

Does love change the way you think?
A landmark experiment in Pisa, Italy showed that early love (the attraction phase) really changes the way you think.


Dr Donatella Marazziti, a psychiatrist at the University of Pisa advertised for twenty couples who'd been madly in love for less than six months. She wanted to see if the brain mechanisms that cause you to constantly think about your lover, were related to the brain mechanisms of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

By analysing blood samples from the lovers, Dr Marazitti discovered that serotonin levels of new lovers were equivalent to the low serotonin levels of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder patients.

Love needs to be blind
Newly smitten lovers often idealise their partner, magnifying their virtues and explaining away their flaws says Ellen Berscheid, a leading researcher on the psychology of love.

New couples also exalt the relationship itself. "It's very common to think they have a relationship that's closer and more special than anyone else's". Psychologists think we need this rose-tinted view. It makes us want to stay together to enter the next stage of love -- attachment.

Stage 3: Attachment
Attachment is the bond that keeps couples together long enough for them to have and raise children. Scientists think there might be two major hormones involved in this feeling of attachment; oxytocin and vasopressin.

Oxytocin - The cuddle hormone

Oxytocin is a powerful hormone released by men and women during orgasm. 
It probably deepens the feelings of attachment and makes couples feel much closer to one another after they have had sex. The theory goes that the more sex a couple has, the deeper their bond becomes. 
Oxytocin also seems to help cement the strong bond between mum and baby and is released during childbirth. It is also responsible for a mum's breast automatically releasing milk at the mere sight or sound of her young baby.

Diane Witt, assistant professor of psychology from New York has showed that if you block the natural release of oxytocin in sheep and rats, they reject their own young.

Conversely, injecting oxytocin into female rats who've never had sex, caused them to fawn over another female's young, nuzzling the pups and protecting them as if they were their own.



Vasopressin
Vasopressin is another important hormone in the long-term commitment stage and is released after sex.

Vasopressin (also called anti-diuretic hormone) works with your kidneys to control thirst. Its potential role in long-term relationships was discovered when scientists looked at the prairie vole.

Prairie voles indulge in far more sex than is strictly necessary for the purposes of reproduction. They also -- like humans - form fairly stable pair-bonds.

When male prairie voles were given a drug that suppresses the effect of vasopressin, the bond with their partner deteriorated immediately as they lost their devotion and failed to protect their partner from new suitors.


And finally . . . how to fall in love
Find a complete stranger.
Reveal to each other intimate details about your lives for half an hour.
Then, stare deeply into each other's eyes without talking for four minutes.

York psychologist, Professor Arthur Arun, has been studying why people fall in love.
He asked his subjects to carry out the above 3 steps and found that many of his couples felt deeply attracted after the 34 minute experiment. Two of his subjects later got married.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.

Anais Nin

There are two basic motivating forces: fear and love. When we are afraid, we pull back from life. When we are in love, we open to all that life has to offer with passion, excitement, and acceptance. We need to learn to love ourselves first, in all our glory and our imperfections. If we cannot love ourselves, we cannot fully open to our ability to love others or our potential to create. Evolution and all hopes for a better world rest in the fearlessness and open-hearted vision of people who embrace life.

John Lennon

title: Ladies, is this what you're looking for? (The no BS version)
text:
I think I've finally figured it out. At least to a certain extent I've grasped what a woman really wants. I get it. I really do. Took a long time but I've seen the light. A lot of heartache on both of our ends. 

1. A nice guy but not too nice. Not too needy but not closed and withdrawn. Someone who isn't stubborn and unwilling to talk about life and love. I get it now. 
2. Someone who cares about his looks and being healthy. It's really that simple.
3. Have goals and ambition beyond just how your fantasy football team does or if your softball team wins. Don't ever be just satisfied with your existence on Earth. 
4. Don't be a slob. Own more than 2 pairs of jeans and more than 2 pairs of shoes. Know how to dress. Take pride in yourself. Again, I get it. 
5. Be a man. Not a boy. Not someone who is "trying to find myself". Or "working on me". That's bullshit. There's no finding yourself. Only making yourself. 
6. Know how to rock your work in the bedroom. Read you well enough to know the nights when you want to cuddle vs. having to change the sheets in the morning. 
7. Family and friends are everything. Even if I don't like certain things about them I should just keep my mouth shut. It'll only do damage by judging anyone. As long as they love you and treat you with love and respect that should be good enough for me. Bingo
8. Money isn't everything but you're not looking to struggle. No woman wants to worry about money. Don't let money burn a hole in your pocket either. It's okay to save. Just don't be a tight ass. 
9. They're exes for a reason. Less you talk about them the better. You hate talking about them just as much as I do. If there's kids involved that's one thing but don't harp and worse yet don't compare. Be the best dad you can be. 
10. Without trust any relationship is toast. TOAST. You always find out. Even if it's something very simply and platonic but honest. It's not worth hiding anything. Same goes for you. Read you loud and clear.
11. The grass isn't always greener somewhere else. Take care of the grass you have right in front of you and life and love can be awesome. Keep watering and tending to it. If not there's someone else who will turn that brown lawn into a masterpiece. 
12. Do things you don't really like to do. That's what you do for your partner. Do them and don't bitch about it before, during and after. 
13. You'll remember my mistakes forever but you can and will forgive. That's what women do. Just don't let it get out of hand and be honest. 
14. You're a lot freakier than you let on. It's my job to open up the vault. 
15. Never, ever take it all for granted because one text or phone call can end it all, forever. 

If you read this I'd just like to say thank you. If you choose to respond I thank you ahead of time and just know that it means a lot.

title: Jazzinator
text:
The science of love

When do you know if you fancy someone? What does love do to your brain chemicals, and is falling in love just nature's way to keep our species alive?

We call it love. It feels like love. But the most exhilarating of all human emotions is probably nature's beautiful way of keeping the human species alive and reproducing.

With an irresistible cocktail of chemicals, our brain entices us to fall in love. We believe we're choosing a partner. But we may merely be the happy victims of nature's lovely plan.


It's not what you say...
Psychologists have shown it takes between 90 seconds and 4 minutes to decide if you fancy someone.
Research has shown this has little to do with what is said, rather
55% is through body language
38% is the tone and speed of their voice
Only 7% is through what they say



The 3 stages of love
Helen Fisher of Rutgers University in the States has proposed 3 stages of love -- lust, attraction and attachment. Each stage might be driven by different hormones and chemicals.

Stage 1: Lust
This is the first stage of love and is driven by the sex hormones testosterone and oestrogen -- in both men and women.


Stage 2: Attraction
This is the amazing time when you are truly love-struck and can think of little else. Scientists think that three main neurotransmitters are involved in this stage; adrenaline, dopamine and serotonin.

Adrenaline
The initial stages of falling for someone activates your stress response, increasing your blood levels of adrenalin and cortisol. This has the charming effect that when you unexpectedly bump into your new love, you start to sweat, your heart races and your mouth goes dry.

Dopamine
Helen Fisher asked newly 'love struck' couples to have their brains examined and discovered they have high levels of the neurotransmitter dopamine. This chemical stimulates 'desire and reward' by triggering an intense rush of pleasure. It has the same effect on the brain as taking cocaine!

Fisher suggests "couples often show the signs of surging dopamine: increased energy, less need for sleep or food, focused attention and exquisite delight in smallest details of this novel relationship" .


Serotonin
And finally, serotonin. One of love's most important chemicals that may explain why when you're falling in love, your new lover keeps popping into your thoughts.

Does love change the way you think?
A landmark experiment in Pisa, Italy showed that early love (the attraction phase) really changes the way you think.


Dr Donatella Marazziti, a psychiatrist at the University of Pisa advertised for twenty couples who'd been madly in love for less than six months. She wanted to see if the brain mechanisms that cause you to constantly think about your lover, were related to the brain mechanisms of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

By analysing blood samples from the lovers, Dr Marazitti discovered that serotonin levels of new lovers were equivalent to the low serotonin levels of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder patients.

Love needs to be blind
Newly smitten lovers often idealise their partner, magnifying their virtues and explaining away their flaws says Ellen Berscheid, a leading researcher on the psychology of love.

New couples also exalt the relationship itself. "It's very common to think they have a relationship that's closer and more special than anyone else's". Psychologists think we need this rose-tinted view. It makes us want to stay together to enter the next stage of love -- attachment.

Stage 3: Attachment
Attachment is the bond that keeps couples together long enough for them to have and raise children. Scientists think there might be two major hormones involved in this feeling of attachment; oxytocin and vasopressin.

Oxytocin - The cuddle hormone

Oxytocin is a powerful hormone released by men and women during orgasm. 
It probably deepens the feelings of attachment and makes couples feel much closer to one another after they have had sex. The theory goes that the more sex a couple has, the deeper their bond becomes. 
Oxytocin also seems to help cement the strong bond between mum and baby and is released during childbirth. It is also responsible for a mum's breast automatically releasing milk at the mere sight or sound of her young baby.

Diane Witt, assistant professor of psychology from New York has showed that if you block the natural release of oxytocin in sheep and rats, they reject their own young.

Conversely, injecting oxytocin into female rats who've never had sex, caused them to fawn over another female's young, nuzzling the pups and protecting them as if they were their own.



Vasopressin
Vasopressin is another important hormone in the long-term commitment stage and is released after sex.

Vasopressin (also called anti-diuretic hormone) works with your kidneys to control thirst. Its potential role in long-term relationships was discovered when scientists looked at the prairie vole.

Prairie voles indulge in far more sex than is strictly necessary for the purposes of reproduction. They also -- like humans - form fairly stable pair-bonds.

When male prairie voles were given a drug that suppresses the effect of vasopressin, the bond with their partner deteriorated immediately as they lost their devotion and failed to protect their partner from new suitors.


And finally . . . how to fall in love
Find a complete stranger.
Reveal to each other intimate details about your lives for half an hour.
Then, stare deeply into each other's eyes without talking for four minutes.

York psychologist, Professor Arthur Arun, has been studying why people fall in love.
He asked his subjects to carry out the above 3 steps and found that many of his couples felt deeply attracted after the 34 minute experiment. Two of his subjects later got married.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.

Anais Nin

There are two basic motivating forces: fear and love. When we are afraid, we pull back from life. When we are in love, we open to all that life has to offer with passion, excitement, and acceptance. We need to learn to love ourselves first, in all our glory and our imperfections. If we cannot love ourselves, we cannot fully open to our ability to love others or our potential to create. Evolution and all hopes for a better world rest in the fearlessness and open-hearted vision of people who embrace life.

John Lennon

title: Ladies, is this what you're looking for? (The no BS version)
text:
I think I've finally figured it out. At least to a certain extent I've grasped what a woman really wants. I get it. I really do. Took a long time but I've seen the light. A lot of heartache on both of our ends. 

1. A nice guy but not too nice. Not too needy but not closed and withdrawn. Someone who isn't stubborn and unwilling to talk about life and love. I get it now. 
2. Someone who cares about his looks and being healthy. It's really that simple.
3. Have goals and ambition beyond just how your fantasy football team does or if your softball team wins. Don't ever be just satisfied with your existence on Earth. 
4. Don't be a slob. Own more than 2 pairs of jeans and more than 2 pairs of shoes. Know how to dress. Take pride in yourself. Again, I get it. 
5. Be a man. Not a boy. Not someone who is "trying to find myself". Or "working on me". That's bullshit. There's no finding yourself. Only making yourself. 
6. Know how to rock your work in the bedroom. Read you well enough to know the nights when you want to cuddle vs. having to change the sheets in the morning. 
7. Family and friends are everything. Even if I don't like certain things about them I should just keep my mouth shut. It'll only do damage by judging anyone. As long as they love you and treat you with love and respect that should be good enough for me. Bingo
8. Money isn't everything but you're not looking to struggle. No woman wants to worry about money. Don't let money burn a hole in your pocket either. It's okay to save. Just don't be a tight ass. 
9. They're exes for a reason. Less you talk about them the better. You hate talking about them just as much as I do. If there's kids involved that's one thing but don't harp and worse yet don't compare. Be the best dad you can be. 
10. Without trust any relationship is toast. TOAST. You always find out. Even if it's something very simply and platonic but honest. It's not worth hiding anything. Same goes for you. Read you loud and clear.
11. The grass isn't always greener somewhere else. Take care of the grass you have right in front of you and life and love can be awesome. Keep watering and tending to it. If not there's someone else who will turn that brown lawn into a masterpiece. 
12. Do things you don't really like to do. That's what you do for your partner. Do them and don't bitch about it before, during and after. 
13. You'll remember my mistakes forever but you can and will forgive. That's what women do. Just don't let it get out of hand and be honest. 
14. You're a lot freakier than you let on. It's my job to open up the vault. 
15. Never, ever take it all for granted because one text or phone call can end it all, forever. 

If you read this I'd just like to say thank you. If you choose to respond I thank you ahead of time and just know that it means a lot.

You're here on CL because you're curious about the possibility of finding someone to have a secret affair with? Maybe just a sexual connection and some fun, or maybe a little more. But always respecting boundaries.

You are cautious, but serious about meeting someone. We take things at a reasonable pace. We email a bit for basic info. Maybe we talk on the phone. Finally we meet to decide if the attraction is there. Whether this is hours or days depends on both of us.

DISCRETE as in, separate, distinctly apart. Apart from the other parts of our lives.

Generally speaking, beyond the usual amorous activities you should be open minded and interested in trying new things and open to the prospect of following my lead, but not blindly or without your input. What it does mean is that my sexual drive (and stamina) are consistently higher than most people. These are not idle boasts. If you are someone who appreciates regular and sustained sexual attention you are unlikely to find a more ideally equipped activity partner on here or anywhere else, for that matter.

Obviously, there is a lot more to you than that and assume that I am very interested in hearing anything more about yourself that you want to share. Bonus points if you are an artist, a musician, do yoga, or happen to be a creative nerd of some kind, or some combination thereof.

I know it can be intensely awkward writing someone online, so don't feel like you have to impress me with witty banter or sophisticated prose at all. 

To weed out the scammers and spam bots, please describe what you are presently wearing in the subject of your first message. Any messages that are not in the indicated format will be flagged and deleted. Any who do get in touch will find that I give great...message, among other things. title: I am looking for alchemy and be my cheerleader....
text:
I'm looking for mutual alchemy and to be each other's mutual cheerleader but I think it's has to be mutual not one way.... 

Alchemy . . . "the process of taking something ordinary and turning it into something extraordinary, sometimes in a way that cannot be explained." This means I'm looking for a loving, caring, long term relationship with a single, funny, smart, educated woman with an irresistible charming personality, sense of adventure, and lots of common sense. 

When you pair up with someone and live through the day to day challenges of accepting, loving, and living with another person, you have the opportunity to create a beautiful life together out of the ordinary act of living rather than trying to "borrow" excitement, prestige, wealth, youth, or any other characteristic from the other person via "chemistry."

I am 6' tall, charismatic, broad shoulders, hazel-brown eyes, handsome, adventurous, funny, educated, sensual, cute, cultured, and a young working professional. I love traveling, languages, experiencing different cultures and food, helping others, giving back to the community, continuously learning, cooking, music, all things outdoors, keeping fit, and others. I believe that a successful relationship must have at a minimum the following elements:

1) Constant and honest communication - being vulnerable 
2) Zero lies, stealing, manipulating, trickery, or unethical behavior -- that means no white lies either
3) No screaming, violence or abuse of any kind -- there is never any reason for this.
4) An attitude of mutual reconciliation and a desire to makes things work

I'm looking for someone:

* who supports my career vision and allows me to support theirs
* with whom I can grow with and change together
* who shares my values (family, moral, others)
* who reminds me that I am not my accomplishments nor my degree(s), not my paycheck, not my job title, and especially not for my inheritance (I don't have one btw)
* who loves me for who I am 
* who remembers that it's important that we love one another not because of what we have done but because of who we are
* who wants to grow old and wrinkly together
* with whom I can adventure through life with as we grow and change, and with whom I can create something beautiful, extraordinary, and sometimes hard to explain
* who has no or minimal emotional baggage

If this interests you, then to be fair, please write more than one line about yourself, share the basics (name, age, height, etc.), interests, what resonated with you, what you are looking for, what you have been doing with your life as well as where you'd like to go, any questions you have, and include a pic or two and I'll do the same. 

I just moved from the east coast to Los Angeles, CA but I'm in the Seattle area frequently for work. I'm willing to move there or anywhere for the right person so please don't let the distance be a deterrent to exploring if we might be right for each other.

I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Girlfriend Potential Test
text:
Instructions: Please answer the questions below as directed in each section. You will be marked for grammar, spelling, cleverness, creativity and boob-size. Please keep in mind that while this is not an application for a job, your performance on this test will be a reflection of your ability to achieve certain positions once out in the real world. When the clock strikes the hour, you may begin. You have sixty minutes to complete the test. 

Section One: Multiple Choice (Answer All, 5 points)


When submitting answers via email, please paste the question and then your answer selection beside it. 

Q1. Six months into our relationship, I go away to a tropical location with my family for a week over Christmas. This vacation was planned as a family event two years prior to meeting you. This is: 
a) A great opportunity to get some things done without me around. 
b) A great opportunity to attempt to sleep with my college roommate and/or my boss. 
c) A sign that you are probably just a casual thing that I could toss aside at any given moment despite the fact I bought you probably the most thoughtful gift you've ever received and written you a letter for every day that I'll be gone, inciting you to 'Go on the Defensive.' 
d) Occasion to have a sexy dinner at home the night before I leave, and a mini 'welcome home' party when I get back that?s guest list is just you, me, a bottle of wine and a pack of condoms. 

Q2. We've talked every night for eight days (not including the dinner/opera show I took you to on Saturday night that was followed by possibly your worst performance in bed ever, or the Monday night that I came over and we spent the evening making Rachel Ray recipes and watching Heroes followed by the best oral sex I've ever given you), with conversation time averaging about an hour per night. On a Thursday night, when on a deadline, I express a need to get off the phone so I can finish some work and go to bed at a reasonable hour. You: 
a) Express your feelings of devotion in three words or less, then and quickly say goodbye after confirming plans for tomorrow night are still on. 
b) Say goodbye, but then immediately begin talking about something that we hadn't discussed as thoroughly as is scientifically, legally or religiously possible two nights prior. 
c) Take that as a sign that I'm abandoning you, and begin to point out that because of it I have commitment issues, that you're clearly not my priority, and then cry. 
d) Say goodbye, but manage to do it with such menace and venom that I stay on the phone for another three silence filled hours, broken only by fits of gentle weeping and suicide threats. 

Q3. I'm throwing change at your cleavage, which is readily on display in that loose fitting tank top you wear around my place on Sundays after brunch. Do you:
a) Wing the largest of the coins at my head, with an evil glare and then refuse to speak to me for the rest of the day. 
b) Encourage my behavior, and allow me to purchase Afternoon Delights from you at discount prices. 
c) Cry. 
d) Cry and pick a fight with me, taking my actions as a total lack of respect for you and then begin to point out that because of it I have commitment issues, that you're clearly not my priority, and then cry some more. 


Q4. We're having a fight. You: 
a) Throw me out of your apartment, then thirty minutes later send 17 texts and attempt to call 13 times in the space of six minutes. 
b) Give me space when the discussion gets too heated for rational thought, and redress your complaints in a calm manner when we've both had a chance to cool down. 
c) Flip me the bird. 
d) Wail on my junk. 
e) both c and d 
f) realize that the fight is about nothing, and begin creating fictional problems and make wild accusations about my obsession with material goods and having a wandering eye. 
g) f, then d, then c. 

Q5. I play [video games OR tabletop gaming OR fantasy football]. You:

title: Tell me if this sounds familiar.
text:
We come on here or any other dating site/app looking for that special someone. Or maybe it's not even that special someone. Maybe we're in that dark place and we're just looking for a shimmer of light to show us the way out. We've had the relationship (love) we thought was real but like Groundhog's Day we fucked it up. Yes, we fucked it up. Sure, the other person may have hammered in the nail but it was us. We chose them in the first place. We gave them the time. We thought this time was different. We thought we'd learned from the last time. And the time before that. But we didn't. We're back to square one. 
Maybe we're a 5. Maybe we're a 10. In the end we're a zero in our minds. We got beaten down so much in the past that any compliment is seen with a pause. When those compliments add up it turns into a drug. A drug we crave over and over again. We want that validation. The meaning to it all. This person cares. But do they? Do we? You start telling yourself it's only a matter of time before it's over. You start fantasizing. Wow, imagine this. Imagine that. So and so has it made. Man, I wonder what it's like to have lust for someone. To have them lust for me. I wonder what it's like to have that intimacy. The intimacy of knowing that they'd put your needs before theirs. They'd walk over a raging lava pit just to spend 30 minutes with you and walk back across the lava to have the chance another time. 
Then the person you were with moves on. Maybe you hear about it through the rumor mill. Maybe you feel that urge to look them up on Facebook. You see a photo. A status update. And your heart sinks. Your skin feels cold. It's like you're walking the Green Mile. We've all been there. You feel pain. You feel anger. You feel regret. No amount of food, wine, tequila or porn can cover it. 
You tell yourself, "I'm going to concentrate on me. I'm going to get in shape. Figure out what I really want in life. From a relationship. I'm going to concentrate on my kid(s)." Fill in the blank because we all fit the story. Just a different birthday. That's it. Male/Female, we all are looking for that link. That link to happiness. That link to the person who makes it feel right. Where do you find it? Will you know it when you see it? Will they like you back? Will you fuck up again and be back to square one, or is this the time you find what you're meant to have?

A week, a few weeks or maybe even a few months later you think you're over them or at least dealing with it in a responsible manner. They're number is erased from your phone. You don't follow them on Facebook. Then you look at your phone and you see it. You know it when you see it. Their number. A text. It's words but it might as well be your blood. It's a text to say "I hope you're well" or something along those lines but in reality it's some BS attempt to keep the hook in your mouth from coming all the way out. They don't want to know you swam away from the boat. They want to keep you on their line. Maybe they feel guilty. Maybe they're lonely. Maybe they're with someone else but got bored and want to feel excitement again. Maybe they're just a lying sack of shit who has no business being in any semblance of a relationship. So...did you answer back or delete the text?

title: Jazzinator
text:
The science of love

When do you know if you fancy someone? What does love do to your brain chemicals, and is falling in love just nature's way to keep our species alive?

We call it love. It feels like love. But the most exhilarating of all human emotions is probably nature's beautiful way of keeping the human species alive and reproducing.

With an irresistible cocktail of chemicals, our brain entices us to fall in love. We believe we're choosing a partner. But we may merely be the happy victims of nature's lovely plan.


It's not what you say...
Psychologists have shown it takes between 90 seconds and 4 minutes to decide if you fancy someone.
Research has shown this has little to do with what is said, rather
55% is through body language
38% is the tone and speed of their voice
Only 7% is through what they say



The 3 stages of love
Helen Fisher of Rutgers University in the States has proposed 3 stages of love -- lust, attraction and attachment. Each stage might be driven by different hormones and chemicals.

Stage 1: Lust
This is the first stage of love and is driven by the sex hormones testosterone and oestrogen -- in both men and women.


Stage 2: Attraction
This is the amazing time when you are truly love-struck and can think of little else. Scientists think that three main neurotransmitters are involved in this stage; adrenaline, dopamine and serotonin.

Adrenaline
The initial stages of falling for someone activates your stress response, increasing your blood levels of adrenalin and cortisol. This has the charming effect that when you unexpectedly bump into your new love, you start to sweat, your heart races and your mouth goes dry.

Dopamine
Helen Fisher asked newly 'love struck' couples to have their brains examined and discovered they have high levels of the neurotransmitter dopamine. This chemical stimulates 'desire and reward' by triggering an intense rush of pleasure. It has the same effect on the brain as taking cocaine!

Fisher suggests "couples often show the signs of surging dopamine: increased energy, less need for sleep or food, focused attention and exquisite delight in smallest details of this novel relationship" .


Serotonin
And finally, serotonin. One of love's most important chemicals that may explain why when you're falling in love, your new lover keeps popping into your thoughts.

Does love change the way you think?
A landmark experiment in Pisa, Italy showed that early love (the attraction phase) really changes the way you think.


Dr Donatella Marazziti, a psychiatrist at the University of Pisa advertised for twenty couples who'd been madly in love for less than six months. She wanted to see if the brain mechanisms that cause you to constantly think about your lover, were related to the brain mechanisms of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

By analysing blood samples from the lovers, Dr Marazitti discovered that serotonin levels of new lovers were equivalent to the low serotonin levels of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder patients.

Love needs to be blind
Newly smitten lovers often idealise their partner, magnifying their virtues and explaining away their flaws says Ellen Berscheid, a leading researcher on the psychology of love.

New couples also exalt the relationship itself. "It's very common to think they have a relationship that's closer and more special than anyone else's". Psychologists think we need this rose-tinted view. It makes us want to stay together to enter the next stage of love -- attachment.

Stage 3: Attachment
Attachment is the bond that keeps couples together long enough for them to have and raise children. Scientists think there might be two major hormones involved in this feeling of attachment; oxytocin and vasopressin.

Oxytocin - The cuddle hormone

Oxytocin is a powerful hormone released by men and women during orgasm. 
It probably deepens the feelings of attachment and makes couples feel much closer to one another after they have had sex. The theory goes that the more sex a couple has, the deeper their bond becomes. 
Oxytocin also seems to help cement the strong bond between mum and baby and is released during childbirth. It is also responsible for a mum's breast automatically releasing milk at the mere sight or sound of her young baby.

Diane Witt, assistant professor of psychology from New York has showed that if you block the natural release of oxytocin in sheep and rats, they reject their own young.

Conversely, injecting oxytocin into female rats who've never had sex, caused them to fawn over another female's young, nuzzling the pups and protecting them as if they were their own.



Vasopressin
Vasopressin is another important hormone in the long-term commitment stage and is released after sex.

Vasopressin (also called anti-diuretic hormone) works with your kidneys to control thirst. Its potential role in long-term relationships was discovered when scientists looked at the prairie vole.

Prairie voles indulge in far more sex than is strictly necessary for the purposes of reproduction. They also -- like humans - form fairly stable pair-bonds.

When male prairie voles were given a drug that suppresses the effect of vasopressin, the bond with their partner deteriorated immediately as they lost their devotion and failed to protect their partner from new suitors.


And finally . . . how to fall in love
Find a complete stranger.
Reveal to each other intimate details about your lives for half an hour.
Then, stare deeply into each other's eyes without talking for four minutes.

York psychologist, Professor Arthur Arun, has been studying why people fall in love.
He asked his subjects to carry out the above 3 steps and found that many of his couples felt deeply attracted after the 34 minute experiment. Two of his subjects later got married.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.

Anais Nin

There are two basic motivating forces: fear and love. When we are afraid, we pull back from life. When we are in love, we open to all that life has to offer with passion, excitement, and acceptance. We need to learn to love ourselves first, in all our glory and our imperfections. If we cannot love ourselves, we cannot fully open to our ability to love others or our potential to create. Evolution and all hopes for a better world rest in the fearlessness and open-hearted vision of people who embrace life.

John Lennon

title: Ladies, is this what you're looking for? (The no BS version)
text:
I think I've finally figured it out. At least to a certain extent I've grasped what a woman really wants. I get it. I really do. Took a long time but I've seen the light. A lot of heartache on both of our ends. 

1. A nice guy but not too nice. Not too needy but not closed and withdrawn. Someone who isn't stubborn and unwilling to talk about life and love. I get it now. 
2. Someone who cares about his looks and being healthy. It's really that simple.
3. Have goals and ambition beyond just how your fantasy football team does or if your softball team wins. Don't ever be just satisfied with your existence on Earth. 
4. Don't be a slob. Own more than 2 pairs of jeans and more than 2 pairs of shoes. Know how to dress. Take pride in yourself. Again, I get it. 
5. Be a man. Not a boy. Not someone who is "trying to find myself". Or "working on me". That's bullshit. There's no finding yourself. Only making yourself. 
6. Know how to rock your work in the bedroom. Read you well enough to know the nights when you want to cuddle vs. having to change the sheets in the morning. 
7. Family and friends are everything. Even if I don't like certain things about them I should just keep my mouth shut. It'll only do damage by judging anyone. As long as they love you and treat you with love and respect that should be good enough for me. Bingo
8. Money isn't everything but you're not looking to struggle. No woman wants to worry about money. Don't let money burn a hole in your pocket either. It's okay to save. Just don't be a tight ass. 
9. They're exes for a reason. Less you talk about them the better. You hate talking about them just as much as I do. If there's kids involved that's one thing but don't harp and worse yet don't compare. Be the best dad you can be. 
10. Without trust any relationship is toast. TOAST. You always find out. Even if it's something very simply and platonic but honest. It's not worth hiding anything. Same goes for you. Read you loud and clear.
11. The grass isn't always greener somewhere else. Take care of the grass you have right in front of you and life and love can be awesome. Keep watering and tending to it. If not there's someone else who will turn that brown lawn into a masterpiece. 
12. Do things you don't really like to do. That's what you do for your partner. Do them and don't bitch about it before, during and after. 
13. You'll remember my mistakes forever but you can and will forgive. That's what women do. Just don't let it get out of hand and be honest. 
14. You're a lot freakier than you let on. It's my job to open up the vault. 
15. Never, ever take it all for granted because one text or phone call can end it all, forever. 

If you read this I'd just like to say thank you. If you choose to respond I thank you ahead of time and just know that it means a lot.

title: Real Relationship
text:
Hey there, thanks for taking the time to click on my ad. Here's what I am hoping to find on here, of course you don't have to be exactly what I am looking for, so close enough is fine! haha. 

I would like to find a really nice sweet girl, down to earth, has her responsibilities in order, and knows what she wants out of life. I'd like to meet someone who has a strong head on her shoulders, and has enough confidence in herself to take on the world! And definitely isn't afraid to ask for what she wants out of life. She would have some knowledge of things like politics, sports, current events. Meaning she knows how to carry a conversation, and hates awkward silence as much as I do. A girly girl would be ideal, but if you're into off-roading and getting a bit dirty, well that's okay too! Hopefully she is career minded as well, or at least has a stable job. Doesn't mean you have to like it, but it pays the bills you know? 

I am not looking for a woman who is married, separated or is in the process of getting a divorce. There is way too much drama there, and those type of woman are usually still hung up over their ex. Not really my cup of tea, sorry ladies. I am also not looking for someone over 50, or in their late 40's. Nothing against older women, but I doubt we have that much in common. Either than that, I'm pretty much open. 

Here's what I have to offer, I am 35 years old, I earn a decent paycheck. I live on my own, no roommates, I like pets but don't have any. I am a great listener, and can keep a conversation going for hours if the chemistry is there. I have a lot of hobbies that I am into, and I am pretty much up for anything. And sometimes I'm even open to a crazy adventure on short notice as well. There's so much more, so I implore you to find out yourself. 

Anyway, if you liked what you read and are you are interested in getting to know me some more, then please by all means, send me a message and don't forget to include a picture of yourself and let's see what happens. Please put your favorite color in the subject line so I know that you're a real person, and not some spam bot. Those things are annoying! Have a great day.

If you prefer to text vs email, send me your number as well.

title: A Friend in Need
text:
I'm a busy professional, it's not that often that I can get away from work. But when I am able to, I wanna get out and play. But unfortunately I don't usually have a lot of free time to actually go out and find someone to hang around and do things with. Relationships take too much work, and all my friends who are girls have gotten married or are in committed relationships. So I guess ideally, I am looking for a FWB type of thing here on Craigslist. 

Anyway, long story short, I would like to find someone I can click with. Someone who is easy to talk to, great to get along with, and a cute smile doesn't hurt either. A woman who knows what she wants, and isn't afraid to ask for it either. Someone who can definitely make me feel wanted would be perfect! If you are in a bad situation due to the economy, let me know. I want to be the friend that can help you whenever you are in need, someone to turn to when the times are bad, because that's what friends are for. Or even if you just want someone to chat with, or someone to care about what you're going through, I can be that guy to help you out with that as well. 

A friend with benefits type of situation works out the best for me, I just ask that you are available on the weekends, or whenever for that matter. As for preference in woman, doesn't really matter as long as you know what you want. Age doesn't really matter, oh, and having a cute smile never hurt either! I hope to hear from you soon. Please send me a picture with your reply so I know you're not spam, and please put special friend in the subject line as well. Feel free to ask me anything as well.

Send your number or Kik if you prefer to talk that way instead.
